Reviews.Content: This camera failed the first time I brought it into the water.  I prepared the camera according to Panasonic's directions, went into a shallow pool, went underwater, took 6 images, and the camera stopped working.  I sent it in to Panasonic, they denied warranty coverage.  I've now dealt with 5 different departments at Panasonic, they all tow the company line, claiming I abused the camera and their only offer is to sell me a refurbished camera at half-cost.  They've been a total nightmare.That said, watch out....it's a great camera, until you ask it to do what it's supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: Great camera ... until it hit the water!
Reviews.Author: D. Wozny "TurboDiesel"
Reviews.Content: I hate to give this camera a bad review, because the truth is I really like it!  Picture quality is great, it's packed with features, and it seems a very rugged little camera.That said, we bought this camera with the intention to use it while snorkeling in Maui.  As you may have guessed by now, it worked GREAT until we we took it in the water.  It took a few really nice pics and one very good video, then it stopped working.  I decided to take it snorkeling at the hotel beach the day before our excursion to try it out, and that was the end of it.I was very careful to check and make sure the doors were properly secured, and there was no foreign matter on the gaskets.  I rinsed it off properly and let it dry.  Once I opened the battery compartment door, I knew why the camera wasn't working, as there was water inside.  (Only a small amount, but apparently enough)  This was a major disappointment to say the least!So, if you want a camera that has great features, is quite rugged, and can be used in wet (non-submerged) environments, then this is a great choice.  If you want to use the camera underwater, though ....  (There are lots of reviews of people who have used the camera successfully underwater, so perhaps mine was defective?)Fortunately, I had only had the camera a couple of weeks, and Amazon was great about taking the camera back and refunding my money, so that part was a happy ending after all.  (I like this camera so much that I'm thinking of pickup up the new TS2 Lumix model.  Hopefully we'll have better luck with that one, since it's rated for deeper submersion...?)

Reviews.Title: Use it in sea water, and you have a brick.
Reviews.Author: Tummybug
Reviews.Content: This supposedly 'waterproof' camera is not.I used mine 5 times in total, once in the sea, and this was the kiss of death for this expensive gadget.Even though the 'water damage' seal is intact, the camera wont turn on, that's it.Very unimpressed, I thought I would not take a risk buying this branded camera, turn out to be a useless piece of rubbish.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!  Everyone whos sees it wants one!
Reviews.Author: esoterra23
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my purchase of this camera.  The LCD is big and looks really good.  The camera is small and light-weight, making it great for taking pics or videos just about anywhere.  I bought this as an update to our mini-DV video camera and to replace our old 2MP point-and-shoot digital camera.  In fact, when I came across this product on Amazon, I was looking for a compact HD video camera.  Because this looked so much like a typical point-and-shoot still camera, I had my reservations as to whether it could function as a full-featured video camera.  So I read lots of user's reviews before making my purchase and found that almost everyone loves it, especially for video.  The video quality is stunning, much better than I'd expected.  I was even impressed by the recorded sound quality, when playing back the videos on my PC.  Before I read the reviews, I thought that the underwater feature was just a selling gimmick.  Once I played with it in the pool, I discovered that the reason everyone raves about the underwater capabilities of this camera is because it works so well.  Once you shoot some family videos in the pool, any buyer's remorse goes out the window.  After seeing my camera, my sister-in-law ordered one, and now my mom wants one too.  All in all, the camera is smaller, lighter, and works better than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Alexander Scoble "BloggingITGuy"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our honeymoon to Negril Jamaica. We used it for all 4 snorkeling trips that we took as well as for swimming in the ocean multiple times and never had a problem with it.It takes decent pictures in or out of the water, but I wouldn't count on being able to get good shots of fast moving fish, which is pretty much an issue with any point and shoot camera anyhow. They just don't do action well.All in all though, if you need a camera for light underwater use (no more than 10 feet deep) then I highly recommend this camera.One last thing, it does not use a standard USB jack for transferring pictures, so don't make the mistake we made on our trip and not pack the cable. We ended up just putting the memory card in to our Canon camera, so it ended up being ok, but you should be aware of this. It uses a mini-HDMI cable instead.

Reviews.Title: good rugged camera
Reviews.Author: TheCeladon
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2YN0611WKTX8L', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2YN0611WKTX8LloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 3:45 MinsThis is an updated review. So far so good. I've taken this camera into salt water at least 50 times with no problems. The more I use this camera the more I like it. For video I've been using the motion jpeg setting instead of AVCHD which seems easier to edit. For regular photos the quality is what you'd expect from a point and shoot camera. What I like most about this camera besides it being waterproof and rugged is the wide angle lens. This camera has turned out to be my favorite of the half dozen or so digital cameras that I've owned over the past few years. Now it seems that an updated and improved version of this camera has come out. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMW-BCF10PP Battery ONLY!
Reviews.Author: Jim B.
Reviews.Content: According to the Panasonic web site, on the firmware update page for the DMC-TS1, if you install firmware update version 1.2 in the DMC-TS1 camera (or if v1.2 is already installed), then the ONLY battery that will work in the camera is an "authorized" battery.From the Panasonic page as of September 8, 2009:----------[ Warning ]For our customers safety, after this firmware update your Panasonic Digital Camera cannot be operated by unauthorised 3rd party batteries.(Currently there is no authorised 3rd party battery available in the market.)----------Therefore, it seems that the only battery(s) that will work in the TS-1 camera is a genuine Panasonic battery, such as the Panasonic DMW-BCF10PP that is included with the camera. Note the PP at the end of the battery model number.I bought a Power 2000 brand,  model ACD-302 Rechargeable Battery, listed as a replacement for Panasonic BCF-10, at the same time that I bought the camera. The Power 2000 battery looks physically identical to the Panasonic battery, and fits perfectly in both the charger and the camera. But when the camera is powered up, the camera displays a message that the battery cannot be used, then powers off.----------Added September 14.The Lowepro Ridge 30 case is a good fit to the TS-1. The case easily holds the camera and wrist strap, two or three extra batteries in the pocket with the Velcro flap, and several memory cards in the zippered pocket.The case has a belt loop to... er... put the case on your belt. It also has a detachable, thin shoulder strap. Well made, and claimed to be water resistant. (No need to send the case back to Lowepro every year for new seals.)

Reviews.Title: Enclosed lens system is of great value
Reviews.Author: V. Calvin Hoe
Reviews.Content: I work in the wind turbine construction and service business.  The Panasonic TS1 will fill the bill for several reasons.  The weather/water tight case will help keep the dust out.  The drop proof will sure help in dropping breakage.We inspect the turbine pieces during construction; so we take lots of pictures for QA/QC.We document all repairs for before/after results.  So lots of pictures.Extremes of weather (cold) is a factor yet to be tested.  So far, the replacement factor has dropped to less than 30% since we started using the TS1.  Most of our cameras fail because of dust getting in the optics; which in this case is inside the camera.One camera failed when resin from composite got to the power button.  Cannot take the camera apart to fix that problem like the cheaper cameras.I shall up date this file as time goes on.

Reviews.Title: An Outdoorsman's Dream Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael E "Michael E"
Reviews.Content: Here is the cold hard truth, It's the only high quality waterproof,shockproof camera on the market that can take incredible high quality 12mp photos (even hd video)! All the point any shoot settings can be manually reset/set to please even the pickiest snob photographers. Oh, did I mention, it fits in your pocket! As a hunter,fisherman, boater I've been waiting years for a camera of this quality that not only can get wet,but actually perform UNDERWATER! Some of these reviewers need a reality check and realize this is a quantum leap in the digital camera sector! You can pick any camera apart, there are hundreds for sell, but only 5 compacts exist that can take water environments and this is the best of them. Your other options are ,buy a huge diving SLR, wait 3 more years for the next leap in technology, or put a sandwich bag over your existing camera and hope it doesn't rain or you ruin it with a wet hand. Trust me, it will! Bottom line, if your an outdoorsman or a beach or pool bum who would like great photos in all environments, buy this one. And remember,  waterproof also means dirt and dustproof.Technical info is available on several sites if you need it. This was one on my best purchases.I can't wait for the next rain soaked vacation!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, Great pictures
Reviews.Author: W. Blum
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from an olympus waterproof camera; the Panasonic takes much much  better pictures. Only thing I noticed is I sometimes get my finger in front of the lens in movie mode but I am probably still getting used to holding.I am using a 32gb sandisk (class 4) memory card with no problems in hd video mode. Pictures at full resolution are between 4 and 5 mb. Camera power on time is fast and shutter lag is good (i've used many digital cameras and this one is one of quickest i have used)I would say pictures are almost comparable to brothers panasonic dmc-fx150 which has full extending lense. I would recommend that camera if dust and water wasn't a concern. Almost the same size closed up.I would like to have time-lapse / interval record mode otherwise 5 stars best compact waterproof camera available.

Reviews.Title: Great features and picture quality, but it leaked
Reviews.Author: James M. Reid
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my point and shoot digital camera and I decided that the underwater, durable cameras had reduced in size and price enough that I could go with one of those as my primary daily camera. I went with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 because of its size and its ability to shoot 720P AVCHD video. The camera took great photos and very good video and I would highly recommend it as a durable outdoor digital camera. However, it is simply NOT capable of being used underwater reliably. The doors on the device for accessing the battery, SD card, and HDMI port are simple "snap" doors. It needs some type of clamp system to create a better seal. The very first time I used it underwater, it leaked and the camera broke. Luckily, I was still within my return period, so I returned it for a full refund. There are other underwater cameras that are better constructed for underwater use, but they don't have the feature set of the Lumix DMC-TS1. This is Panasonic's first entry into the underwater camera market, so hopefully next year's model will have the same, if not better, feature set but a better method of sealing the camera.

Reviews.Title: To Boldly Go Where No Camera Has Gone Before
Reviews.Author: S. Sethi "Camera Cassanova"
Reviews.Content: Though it has a couple of annoyances which are the awkward Zoom button and no lens cap, it is a Magnificent camera. Image Quality is great, thanks to the Leica lens.You can go Anywhere, never worrying about water, rain etc. This is the perfect complement to my Olympus E510 DSLR. I take it everywhere and have taken great shots. It's like having a SUV to complement your Sedan.Best part, you can switch between photos and Video recording immediately, with no dials to turn.To sum up, if it were a Car, it's not a Land Rover, but a Porsche Cayenne, Solid, Refined, Comfortable and Reliable.To top it off, when feasible, how about a 32GB SDHC capacity?? With one or two of these cards, storage problems would be a thing of the past.

Reviews.Title: Works well, seems solid
Reviews.Author: N. Hoy "NateHoy"
Reviews.Content: Image quality in bright light is really excellent, flash is very good for a camera of this size and class, and the waterproofing does the job (took a few pictures from underwater in the kitchen sink the first day, figuring if I ruined it in water I'd better do it early).  Response time is very good, camera is loaded with features (and the facial recognition works surprisingly well).PRO: - Waterproof (which was the primary reason I bought it). - Better than average battery life (lasted about a week of light use). - Macro mode is really impressive, though the flash can "white out" the macro really easily if you're not careful composing your shot. - Nice wide angle lens.  You don't know how handy that is until you convert to a wide angle camera. - No external moving parts.  I like that in a ruggedcam. - Big, beautiful, bright screen and easy controls. - Build quality:  Doors are all nice latched things with spring hinges, waterproof seals look really good, all nice alumimum with very little plastic. - 720p video.  It's da bomb.  Even casual clips of stuff look really good.  Not "BBC Planet Earth" good, but far better than a camera this size seems like it should be capable of.  Audio is relatively clear, and the images are just amazing. - Picture quality.  Wow.  Just... wow.  In outdoor light (even clouds) images are just, well, astonishingly good.  Crisp, clear, colors seem good. - Obviously replaceable gaskets on the doors.  Because stuff wears out.  No idea how much replacements cost, but the current gaskets are well-made and look durable, and any damage to them is going to be visible.NEUTRAL: - Exposed lens.  Torn on this one, because I don't want moving parts in a ruggedcam, but I'd like the lens protected when not in use.  It is nicely recessed and seems durable, so I'll mark this as a "neutral" - Large and heavy for the "teeny camera" class.  But then again, it's waterproof and needs to be rugged, and you need a little extra heft.  It dwarfs my Elph, but still fits in a pocket easily.  For the "small waterproof" class, this does well. - MTS video default.  I disliked this at first, until I learned that Linux Mint supports the video format easily (it just doesn't like the file extension, so I had to associate that with a video player).  With the right codecs (right in the repositories), all of the popular Linux video editors had no problem loading it, editing it, and transcoding it to anything I wanted.CON: - Indoor photography is a tad noisier than I had hoped without flash use.  Not terrible, but not as good as I had hoped.  Image stabilization seems to work pretty well, though.  It's better than my old Elph, so I'll give credit where credit is due for a tiny camera like this with a small lens. - Connector on the camera side is not USB.  C'mon, guys.  I know the connector has other uses than USB, but put a USB-Micro or USB-Mini port on the camera.All in all, it's a great all-around camera, and it's almost a bonus that it's waterproof, even though I bought it primarily for that reason (I kayak quite a bit, and want something I can just strap to my PFD and not have to tuck in a bag every time I want to roll).  It responds well, the controls are relatively simple, it has decent 2-3 keypress shortcuts for a lot of the features, and it certainly looks like they knew what they were doing when they built it.If you want a waterproof camera, reviews are split between this and the Olympus D-10.  This has a slightly better shape for pocketing, and is a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC T151 Review
Reviews.Author: G. Speck
Reviews.Content: Am totally please with functions for all aspects.  I bought this for snorkeling and kayaking but have used it also for hiking as it is impact resistant. Most photos are excellent. The video is as good as my Cannon HV20 and functions well underwater.  I disagree with other reviewer on the video button, it is separate from the shutter release.  You can switch to video by simply pressing the red video button on the rear to start and end the video shot.  There is a blue cast when shooting directly into a backlit sun shot, but that is the only flaw.  Good presets and easy to get used to.  The AVCHD lite imports easily into IMovie and related programs. Does great upload to You Tube in HD.

Reviews.Title: Leaked after 4 days at beach
Reviews.Author: Snorkeler
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Hawaii. It leaked after the 4th day on the beach and the camera failed. The instructions are extensive for keeping the camera from leaking. I believe I followed the instructions in the manual. I have returned the camera to Panasonic, 10 days ago, and have not heard back from them.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1
Reviews.Author: Ken2
Reviews.Content: Its only waterproof to 10ft, but thats all I need.Its small enough to fit in your pocket fairly easily.The features and menus are well thought out and easy to use.Video quality is very good. As of now, this is the only waterproof pocket size camera with HD video, and Zoom during video. It works well and the quality is great.The picture quality is good as well. Nice sharp pictures.I haven't dropped it yet to check the "shock proof" part of it, but hopefully that goes well.I'm definitely happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof! Decent Pics
Reviews.Author: Michael Cain
Reviews.Content: I took the camera on a couple boat trips, and even went body surfing with it, and it held up well. The camera was rugged, as advertised. It didn't mind getting wet.Pictures were decent, not great, quality, but easy enough to tweak with freeware.The video format was irritating, as I can only download it with Panasonic Software. With that, the quality was great.*****Then I dove underwater to take a picture of a fish.  Though I was only about three feet underwater this was enough to break the waterproof seal.  Four weeks on and I am still trying to get it replaced under warranty.  Currently no one is answering the phone at the Panasonic McAllen Exchange Center.

Reviews.Title: Excelent choice
Reviews.Author: R. Miranda
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera recently, and I must say it has exceded my expectations. The quality of the photos is really good, the waterproof system works with no problem and the HD videos in daylight are truly amazing. One of the things I really like is how long the battery life is. I thought the lithium battery would be a problem, specially when you go out on vacations and you don't have a place to plug the charger all the time. Anyway, this little battery lasts so much that's not an issue. This is the perfect camera. Totally Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera all around
Reviews.Author: Christina M. Fan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a waterproof, shock-proof camera that was vacation-proof and me-proof, seeing as how I tend to be a little clumsy.  However, I did not want to spend the money if I was going to be getting a camera that could not really be used for normal everyday use with friends, family, pets, etc.  I was very concerned that it was even possible, because I had been reading reviews on other cameras and there was a lot of mention of compromised image quality.  I had read great reviews on the Canon d10, but the camera was a little bulky when I saw it in person, for a camera that I wanted to bring everywhere with me, or slip in my pocket or purse.I decided to pay the extra money for this camera, and I'm glad that I did.  The images come out great above water, and the HD video is solid.  Even my brother commented that the pictures looked really great, when using my camera at a family event.  I also used this camera at the beach (the water in CA is a bit murky for any clear pictures) and filming my brother swimming (so he can look at what he needs to work on).  The camera worked great above and under water, and the video looks clean.  Underwater photos don't look 100% sharp like above-water pictures do, but honestly, if I showed someone the picture, they would never notice.One comment I noticed in other reviews was that the buttons were a little small  or closely placed, but I haven't really had a big problem with that.I got the green camera.  It's a nice shade of green, nothing too flashy but not boring either.

Reviews.Title: outstanding camera for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Liebschner
Reviews.Content: We only have this camera for a month now and haven't used all the features, but this camera is one of the best we had in a long time. This far, we owned 6 digital cameras, everything from ultra compact to a larger size body - from cheap to moderately expensive. I don't think we will ever use all the features but it's great to browse through them and get to learn them. There are also two demo video's on the camera to demonstrate some of the features on the go.Due to the small size, the flash isn't as powerful as with larger cameras. Just something you have to deal with with any compact or ultra compact cameras. The other thing is that the lens doesn't have a cover, meaning there is always a chance that some finger smudges are on the lens when you take it out of your pocket.It's very easy to switch between picture mode and taking movies, just press the movie record button while in picture mode. I love this feature, there is no fiddling around with buttons to switch from one to the other. However, the one thing I couldn't figure out yet is to display the length of the movie while you are recording instead of posting the remaining maximum time you have for recording the movie. That would be nice to find since that helps to determine the movie size. I rather have two small movies instead of one large.Battery life is good, I am not concerned about not having a spare battery.

Reviews.Title: For Use with new Windows Movie Maker
Reviews.Author: J. Toren "There is a God and I'm not Him"
Reviews.Content: Hey if you have Vista or Windows 7 make sure you get the new Windows Movie Maker that can handle this video. I simply drag and drop the file into Movie Maker and then chop it up how I want it and save my new movie.  Worked like a charm!Pros: Great at pictures and video. I used it on a mission trip to Alabama with my youth group and it did its job well. I even took pictures and video while in the Gulf of Mexico. I could put the camera on the Intelligent Auto mode, hand it to the kids and not worry about it getting wet or dropped and at the same time get good pictures or video. It is very easy to use.Cons: Protect the screen on which you view pictures! I tossed this camera in a pocket in my backpack for the ride back from the Gulf of Mexico and when I pulled it out the screen was scratched up right in the center. I think I had my keys in the same pocket of the backpack but this camera sure wasn't as tough as I thought it would be. Now I worry about the lens. I talked to Crutchfield about returning it and they would have let me but I still elected to keep it (outweighing the scratches were the free memory card and camera case from Panasonic).Pointers: AVCHDLite that people complain about isn't that big a deal. Free programs that you can download and use with the .mts file (that is the file type AVCHD hides in some obscure random folder so look for it) are VLC media player or you can install the FFDShow MPEG-4 decoder which when installed helps Windows Media Player play your .mts files flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Another TS1 bites the dust.
Reviews.Author: Tummybug
Reviews.Content: I really should have read the reviews more carefully before buying this expensive camera.The point is that some TS1s seem to be waterproof, some not. Mine was of the latter type. Sea water killed it, even though I followed the instructions manual to the letter.I am very unhappy about this purchase, will most definitely NOT buy Panasonic ever again.

Reviews.Title: Works good but some big problems too.
Reviews.Author: A. Heyer
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about 1 week. Taking pictures underwater is really nice. I never went yet at more than 3 or 4feet. Fish pictures can be good even if the camera is sometimes a bit too slow.My main problems is that I have been suffering condensation on the lens on the first week, without being in the water. OK I was on a boat in the bayou with real high humidity. But I dont see that as normal for a waterproof camera. Am I supposed to return the camera? (edit: it is normal according to the company: not to me as it did not even went under water)Other than that my wife enjoy the camera and the automatic mode. I miss do not have priority mode. The camera is a bit poor on very low lights (concerts) but acceptable. Maybe 8megapixels with higher sensitivity would have been better.I am glad I bought a spare battery because it does not last very long. I mean my wife can make 200pictures in a little time and then it is over. I think I need to buy a car charger too for the road trips.The lcd screen is not bright enough under high sun. My previous lumix was better on that point.The power button is a bit frustrating but not as much as some reviews said.Global picture quality is very nice. Video is working well too. I still think it is one of the best point and shoot waterproof camera. For the price I would have love loved to have a adapted neopren casing.Edit: After two years camera stopped working. I opened it was all oxidated inside. Obviously water entered in it. I never dived with this cam and took it not that much under water, allways washed joints and never in the water with baterry trap open. I did not make the joint replaced after one year, not worth it for the price of the cam. To me it was a bit of a disappointing end. I lost a couple of picture that were still on the built in memory (damn proprietary cable). My wife miss this camera, but I dont. I am still looking for a camera like that with better ISO and better water abilities...

Reviews.Title: Versatile and not-so-versatile
Reviews.Author: K. Ong
Reviews.Content: A month after I bought this camera, I took it to an aquatic park to try out the waterproof feature. Complying with all of the precautions noted in the user's manual, water somehow seeped in where the battery was store, and the camera promptly stopped working. Panasonic is now replacing the camera. Aside from that, it takes great HD photos and movies.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Ask for a Better Camera
Reviews.Author: Joe H Jones III
Reviews.Content: I have owned this product for over 3 years now and absolutely love it.Most recently my wife and I took this on our honeymoon to St. Lucia.  This thing still functions and performs like it did the day I pulled it out the box.  I took this out while swimming in the ocean and snorkeling in the ocean.  While at St. Lucia we got hit by Hurricane Ernesto and naturally I wanted to take a video of the ocean and tide.  The video quality produced by this camera exceeds my expectations still today.  I took this camera on a jungle mountain bike ride also and actually had an incident and fell right on top of the camera.  The camera had zero issues with it after the fall!  I weigh 165 lbs. and fell directly onto the camera.I am also an avid hiker and take this camera with me on all hikes.  It has worked flawlessly in the cold atop a 14,000 ft mountain with 40 MPH winds, snow and ice, and temperatures in the teen's.My wife is a photography nut and would say this takes mediocre to average pictures.  But for someone that is an outdoor enthusiast looking for a sturdy camera that will last and take what I consider great pictures and video, chose this one.

Reviews.Title: Camera leaked
Reviews.Author: J Smith
Reviews.Content: Camera lasted less than 2 years before it leaked water after being submerged to about 3 feet in fresh water. Both door seals were carefully checked each time it was taken into the water, including the time it leaked. Not sure it leaked through one of the two doors however as the batter and SD card were dry. Water first appeared near the top of the screen, later fogged over the lens.Was a good camera up to this point, taking reasonable photos, rugged, and small.

Reviews.Title: Crapped out on 2nd underwater trip
Reviews.Author: S. Fischer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera back in Aug. 2009 shortly after it was introduced.  The intent was to use it while snorkling in the Caribbean on a cruise. I used it underwater on three different dates during that cruise.  Although the viewfinder had a bit of fogging everything else seemed to work ok.  Per the instructions, I soaked it in fresh water after use and thoroughly dried it prior to opening the battery door.  At this point, I'm still happy.Took the camera with us again for use on a western Caribbean cruise in Jan. 2012.  Again intended use is snorkling photos.I again examined the camera's battery door and made sure no sand or foreign objects were in the battery door seal.  (Even used Panasonic's little brush).  Took the camera into the water on the first day of snorkeling (never under 5 feet, I might add) and that was the last time the camera functioned.  I first noticed that my setting had changed on its' own from "underwater" to randomly changing settings.  Brought the camera out of the water and attempted to change the scene setting again to "underwater".  No luck. Tried turning the camera off, then on again.  No luck.  The final death occurred when the camera refused to even turn on again.VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THIS CAMERA!.Paid $340 to J&R; through Amazon back in 2009 for the limited functionality of this camera.I also see that my case is not an isolated one.  MANY other folks have encountered the same problems.

Reviews.Title: Good for a super compact, but no good for low light
Reviews.Author: Kaichu Dento
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a year and a half, but no flash working for the last year now. Loaned it out and it came back that way, so no idea what caused it to quit, although the rest of the camera is still in daily use.One reason I chose this camera was that I wanted to have as much zoom as possible, but not to have to deal with the breakability of protruding lenses, which I have broken every time I've owned one.Today I tried taking some shots of a couple bears and the slowness of this camera caused me to miss out on a couple great shots as one of the bears was walking. The best thing about this camera for me is simply that it stays right at my side day in and day out. I just wish they would offer one that had better low light capability and operated quicker between shots.

Reviews.Title: Sold it
Reviews.Author: AS "Amazonian"
Reviews.Content: Didn't like it, couldn't stand the picture quality. The shutter lag was intolerable, I would click to caputure a moment and it failed every time. It was hard to photograph kids.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: B. Williams
Reviews.Content: Great camera as long as you do not submerge.  I checked all everything out and the first time that I submerged the camera the battery compartment leaked within a few minutes and now does not work.  I looked online and found that this is an issue.  I am extremely disappointed that this happened.  Before this happened I used it out of water and absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof under 10 meters. Not waterproof under 10 feet.
Reviews.Author: P. Clydesdale "white trash art"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after losing my last Lumix to a leaky bottle of water in my backpack, specifically because it was waterproof. I took it in a pool yesterday in less than 10 feet of water and water leaked into the compartment that houses the battery and memory card. It is ruined. I am finished buying Panasonic Lumix cameras.

Reviews.Title: High price to pay for 4 uses...
Reviews.Author: Namita Bisaria "Namstar"
Reviews.Content: This camera, albeit a great buy for taking fabulous underwater pictures, is not made for extensive use for underwater snorkeling.  After four days of snorkeling in Hawaii and following the directions for cleaning and locking the battery and memory card compartment correctly, the camera filled with water in about 4 feet of water and ceased to work.  That's a huge shame for a week's worth of images and 200+ dollars.  I don't know how many users have attempted to really use the camera beyond a fish tank or two, but it's something to consider.  Maybe it won't happen to you.

Reviews.Title: leaked at the first time
Reviews.Author: F. Rickert
Reviews.Content: on the first day i went snorkeling in vietnam the camera leaked! i'm really disappointed and can defeninitely not recommend the camera, if you want to use it in the sea.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for All Weather
Reviews.Author: V. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I'm an occasional photographer, so I wanted something small and easy to use. Bought this to take on a recent trip. It poured the rain every day and the camera worked flawlessly. Got great shots of a sculpture garden in the rain. It has exceeded all my expectations. Haven't tried it underwater yet. Battery is easy to charge and easy to change. Auto-focus works great for me, since I don't care to spend a lot of time with settings.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1
Reviews.Author: Josh Sprague "JS"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hoping that it wouldn't be too cumbersome and assumed picture quality was a no brainer. Overall it's heavier than most digital cameras but that is to be expected as it's waterproof and shockproof so I'm good with that. The picture quality is absolutely horrible though. That part simply amazes me since so much work was obviously put into making a strong robust camera. I would not recommend this camera to anyone unless you want something waterproof. I've had 3 megapixel cameras years ago that take better quality pictures. I'm an experienced photographer and far above the average Joe when it comes to understanding manual settings as well as the automatic ones. I've tried many of the automatic default features, didn't even get into much of the manual stuff, and none of the auto features on this camera take good photos.

Reviews.Title: NOT 100% WATERPROOF BUT 100% WORTHLESS
Reviews.Author: Sebastien Franssen
Reviews.Content: Not much to say... I was looking for a waterproof camera. I have used it really carefully but it leaked after 10 minutes underwater.Panasonic doesn't want to replace it. So be warned... Considering the number of people complaining about the issue I would imagine that their "waterproof" camera is not yet 100% reliable

Reviews.Title: A Mini Studio
Reviews.Author: Photobug
Reviews.Content: This is quite a little camera.  Just took it on vacation for two weeks, and although I did not submerge it, it did survive the rains of a hurricane.......!  The photos are very sharp and the colors are good.  Video is excellent in 720P, but did notice that the whites tend to blow out easily .  Suppose a white balance is in order.  Be advised, the AVCHD Lite format that is used for the HD video recording may present format issues on your PC if it is not running Win 7.  Mac's will have no problem with the format.  If you have questions about the video capabilities of this unit, type ' Panasonic DMC-TS1 ' in a YouTube search and check 'em out in HD.  It sells itself.

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Online Shopper
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little camera at all.  Indoor shots are good, outdoor shots are much better and video is good too.  For the price I paid it is a great little travel camera.  I haven't tried the underwater shots yet, but it will be the only camera I take on vacations as it is much smaller than my mega zoom Panasonic camera.  I am sure the new TS2 is much better, but the price I paid for this one couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: A rugged little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera for the money. The only substantial shortcomings are the placement of the lens in the upper left corner of the body which makes holding the camera a little awkward and the clustering of the controls in the lower right of the back making them easy to accidentally hit while using the camera. Also, it would have been nice if they used a standard USB cable for the interface so one wouldn't have to worry so much about losing the one that came with the camera.

Reviews.Title: One of the Best Travel Cameras
Reviews.Author: Big-Z
Reviews.Content: I have owned 32 digital cameras since 1992 and so I am very picky about image quality as the number one factor in keeping or selling a camera. I only have four of the 32 at the present time and this camera is one of them. Picture quality outside in plenty of light is amazing and compares very well to my 35mm digicam. Pictures are clean, bright, lively, and just plain beautiful. Even looking at side by side comparisons with this cam and my 35mm at the pixel level reveals little difference. The optics and the HD processor are great. Movies in the new format are amazing as well. It is a keeper.I cannot attest to its sturdiness or seals since I only plan to use it in rain and snow, so no testing underwater for me. In low light indoors, it is similar to other great pocket cams but not much better, but out in nature, it is outstanding. I like all the Panasonic cameras I have had over the past few years and another Lumix is on my keeper list. This is THE best travel camera for the price to date, since it is small, relatively light, and has no protruding lens. In short, there is no sacrifice in picture quality for the folded optics or the waterproofing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for fly fishing and underwater video
Reviews.Author: Steven Adkins
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for fly fishing and could not be happier. It works great and takes awesome pictures. From fish to flies (nice macro settings) and underwater video of releasing trout, I am very happy wiht my purchase. I looked around and compared the other cameras features and prices and picked this one. It has 720p video, waterproof, shockproof (dropped it yesterday in the South Fork of the Boise while I was landing a rainbow, still works great), and takes great macro for flies and insects.I had read the reviews and was concerned about battery life and have been very happy with the amount of time that it keeps a charge. Also read reviews about the waterproof seals and have no complaints about it. I do try to air out the camera after every trip and make sure the seals are clean.Great camera that I would recommend and buy again in a heart beat. Worth the money on a camera that will be on my vest for years.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: James Strutz
Reviews.Content: Everything works as advertised. Image quality is very good for a camera in it's class (waterproof point & shoot). The menu and control layout is typical Panasonic, which is to say, easy to understand & practical. All the most used controls are quickly available, and the rest aren't hard to find. The wide zoom lens is very practical, and seems to focus well. Image quality up to 400 ISO is decent enough, and barely acceptable at 800. The competition isn't any better, and some are far worse. Panasonic's image stabilization is first rate as well, and video quality and ease of use are tops.The only real criticism I have is the potential for flare. This is nothing new, and no other waterproof point & shoot seems to do any better. But if you are shooting with the light in front but off to the side, try to shade the lens with your hand or you will get light streaks.The one other minor gripe is that the lens should be mounted in the middle instead of along the edge. In this position it is far too easy to get your finger in the picture, or to smudge the glass.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy almost pocket sized
Reviews.Author: Amazon Reviewer "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Great build quality with tons of optional picture taking modes. Relatively easy to use and remember the various functions available. Terrific picture quality - but don't expect the same quality you would get from a top quality SLR. (I do own a top quality SLR to compare the results with). I have made excellent 8x10 prints and pretty darn good 13x19 prints as well. I haven't used it underwater yet however but the sealing seems adequate.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera with video capabilities!
Reviews.Author: D. Roberts "d rock"
Reviews.Content: This camera really is incredible. For the features that it has, the waterproofing, and the video quality it was a knock out for me. Now, for those of you who have been looking up the specs on this camera, it says that you can record 720p at 30fps. Actually I have run multiple tests and the version that I got runs at 60fps (I got a Class 10 SDHC card though so I am not sure if the speed of the card matters or not). I have heard mixed reviews about this and some people say it runs at 30 some people say it runs at 60, so I would imagine if you bought a fast SDHC card then you could probably record at 60 as well. It really looks incredible too. The video roughly in SH mode runs about 22 to 26 mbps. Which is pretty uncompressed. The pictures are really really good as well. The only thing I will say is if you are expecting this camera to blow you away with pictures, then you have to be in a good lit area. The macro is absolutely astounding though, it truly is as good as they say, you can almost get just a few mm away from a subject and still take a clear, high def picture. For me, just the ability of the waterproofing, video options, and the Ai photo capabilities I was sold on this camera. This also is round 2 or 3 ( I cant remember) for Panasonic doing a waterproof camera and it really shows. All of the ports are protected in a nicely rubber lined sealing and the screen is a very nice large size. I would completely recommend this camera if you are looking for a great camera, camcorder, and rugged tag along.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Dee "Dee"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Lumix - TS1 and I love it.  I am a basic user and I found the camera very easy to use.  The pictures are crisp.  The only critism I have is that it has a bulkier body than I would like and the lens is exposed.  But I bought a protective sleeve for it and even though it is bulky, it still fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Photog
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I spent a lot of time researching all the cameras in the waterproof/freeze proof category.  Its easy to use. High quality pics and video.  I use it snorkeling, surfing, snowboarding, ice skating.  No problems with underwater use as long as you follow directions. (make sure the doors are completely closed and rinse after.  If you have an active lifestyle and want a compact camera to go with you, this is the one.  I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the outdoors!
Reviews.Author: A. J. Menard "Al Menard"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to go on a cruise where I was planning of scuba diving.  Pushed the camera well beyond its depth limits.  Came back with great photos of stingrays, coral and fish.  Most people I showed photos to were amazed by the photos and the camera that took them.  It is rugged, and easy to use.  I left my SLR on ship and only carried this into port each time.  Video is crisp, with good color, and easy to shoot.  That was the second most amazing thing, getting such vivid HD video (720) of course underwater at a great price.  Filming while scuba diving was easier than while snorkeling as you can concentrate on being still while being able to breath and maintain buoyancy, more difficult while navigating with a snorkel.A great camera that I would recommend to anyone.In winter I plan on carrying this while snowboarding and shooting video in the terrain parks etc.  Used to always worry about the condensation etc with my other cameras going from really cold to the lodge.  Not anymore.Nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof, shock proof, slim, compact, beautiful, what more could you ask for?
Reviews.Author: Praneeth Wanigasekera "cricket lover"
Reviews.Content: I've finally found a camera that fits perfectly into my lifestyle. I don't need to worry about taking this on a rafting trip (I have a 100 beautiful pictures to prove it), I don't have to worry about putting this thing in my pocket going snowboarding, don't have to worry about "waterproof cases" for snorkeling, no worries about drizzle and rainy conditions: this can handle it all with ease! While doing all this, it still looks like a fashionable "normal" camera.To add to this, the camera has excellent image stabilization, much better than Canon powershot series that I have used. If you have shaky hands, no worries with this camera, you really have to try hard to get a blurry picture. Another cool feature is the "intelligent auto" mode which sets all of the settings automatically adjusting light, focus, etc to just right, although I prefer the regular auto mode for night pictures.Only weakness I can point to is a weak flash (night shots can sometimes not be illuminated enough), and the lack of a lens cover. Also, don't forget to wipe the lens well after it gets wet or night shots can get spotty from dirt in the water and stuff.Other than that, this is an amazing camera and I recommend it enthusiastically to anyone.

Reviews.Title: ***Very pleased***
Reviews.Author: MAC "Mac"
Reviews.Content: I purchased camera 1 month ago and took it on a Disney cruise vacation. It delivered some spectacular pictures and very quick and efficient. I dropped it and also took some great underwater snorkeling pics. My children also were able to take wonderful pics ages 7 and 9 easily. The record mode is easy to use and a great feature for high quality HD video. I definitely would recommend it so far.Battery life is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: A Very Nice All Purpose Camera
Reviews.Author: J-Stroke
Reviews.Content: I like to canoe and I don't want to have to carry any more "stuff" than necessary.  The electronics I do carry need to be waterproof - cell phone, GPS, solar charger, and camera.  I took a chance and ordered this Lumix six weeks before it was released because it claimed to not only be a waterproof still camera but also an HD movie camera.  I've had it for months and have really abused it.  It's been dropped, squashed and dunked more times than I'd like to admit. On my last outing while shooting a video I dropped it in the mud and rinsed it off in the creek, all while it was continuing to record. I am very satisfied with its durability and I'm amazed I haven't scratched the lens or compromised a seal.Still pics are very good (keeping in mind it's a point and shoot). There's not much of a zoom but I was more interested in the wide angle, which is as advertised. I compensate for the limited zoom by shooting all pics at 12MP and blowing them up later as needed.Movies are okay but don't expect it to compare to a dedicated HD camcorder. The video quality is very good but the "stabilization" is limited and the zoom feature does not pan in and out slowly and smoothly; it has one zoom speed - fast. Bottom line, the HD video component is a great bonus feature on a very nice compact waterproof still camera, nothing more.The rechargeable battery seems to last forever, even when shooting videos, but I do carry a backup for long trips. If you plan on taking many videos get a couple of SD cards of at least 8GB.All in all, I am very pleased. If you have the money and space to lug an HD camcorder with you in addition to your compact camera, you would be better off doing so. But if you want a small package that does nothing great but many things well, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Raghu Inti
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner (basic user) camera user. I was using the Lumix FZ5 with good results and was looking for a waterproof camera. It was a toss up between this and the canon D10. I chose this for its portability and wide angle.Bought this camera for our trip to Florida. It is an excellent waterproof camera, worked well in/on the beach. The pictures were sharp. The colors were accurate. A little too much noise at higher ISO levels, but that is pretty standard at this camera level. In low light situations, the flash is a little too bright and makes the pictures appear a little artificial. Love the videos it generates. Very portable and great looking camera, unlike the egg shaped canon, which can look out of place for every day use.I recommend this camera with very minor reservations (not enough to drag it down to 4 stars).

Reviews.Title: well.. not that impressed!
Reviews.Author: missceline
Reviews.Content: Well, after a trip on a beach and our old Sony cybershot camera getting sandy, we decided to look into the "tough Cameras".  We were very excited about getting this Panasonic.  After  a few weeks of use in different circumstances we were a bit disappointed though about the image quality.  Low light images are so grainy I feel like back 10 years ago technology.The very good thing was the macro. I was very impressed by the picture quality and as well the Wide angle which can be useful.I am sad that the overall quality is not as we expected, because we really wanted a "tough camera".  But what the point of having it "tough" is the quality is not met?I am returning it and getting a regular point and shoot Canon PowerShot instead!

Reviews.Title: Died after 3 pictures underwater
Reviews.Author: Naoyuki G. Saito "shibaowner"
Reviews.Content: We would like to think that this is not a typical experience, but in our case, this camera did not work out.  We purchased this camera days before our cruise vacation.  We were actually very happy with the camera (features and portability, especially) and the picture quality, even though I thought the pictures with flash appeared a bit harsh.Unfortunately, the camera died just after 3 pictures underwater while snorkeling.  It appears that the lid/gasket protecting the battery/SD card compartment was faulty on ours.  When we opened the lid (which was latched closed at the time of this "event"), some water came out.  We let the water drain out and we dried the compartment the best we can.  However, the camera never turned on.On the other hand, we are very happy to report that the helpful people at Amazon has arranged for a prompt return and refund.  We were very impressed with their customer service on this occasion.Pros:  Compact, Appears to be sturdy, Good color selection, Decent picture quality for a compact cameraCons:  Menus a bit confusing (too many options), the shape not quite good for steady grip, photographs with flash appear a bit harsh, our camera did not hold water out (probably an isolated case of a defective camera).

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: William J. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a four year old Sony Cybershot and wow have I been impressed. I wanted something a little tougher and waterproof this time so I didn't need a case to take it snorkelling and this fit the bill. Under water pictures turn out great as well as every day pictures. I was concerned that the image quality wouldn't be up to snuff after reading some of the reviews but they are far and above better than the pictures taken with the old Sony. For the price and the features you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Got this camera for kayaking
Reviews.Author: Kevin Lawrence
Reviews.Content: I wanted a waterproof camera that I could take with me in my sea kayak and have readily accessible. I've been using a Nikon Coolpix 4300, but was missing too many pictures opportunities because of the time it takes to remove it from the water-tight bag I carried it in. I also couldn't use it when there was a lot of spray in the air.The Panasonic DMC-TS1 has solved those problems.  With its non-protruding lens it is even smaller than my old Coolpix and slips easily into a pocket on my PFD. I can pull it quickly from the pocket on a moment's notice to capture a picture and can do so at any time in any conditions (as long as I'm able to take at least one hand from my paddle).  I haven't tried putting it in the water, put it has done quite well in fresh and sea water spray.Picture quality is better than I expected.  I'm still getting familiar with all the settings and features, but I'm just blown away by the technology in this little package.  It pays to understand the various settings so that the camera can be used to its best advantages.  I suspect some of the disappointments and complaints I read about in the reviews come from not understanding the operation of the camera well enough.I've tried the video a couple times and have also been impressed with this feature.  This is the first video-capable camera I've ever had and I'm looking forward to doing a lot more with it.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TS1 is almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Griselda G. Santos "JC"
Reviews.Content: This camera is similar to when I bought my Canon digicams where the quality of the images are very good for a point and shoot.  I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a small, waterproof and takes great pictures not as good as DSLR but still very good.  Even the HD video is very good and because it uses AVCHD lite files it records longer videos so that's a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, only 4 faults so far...
Reviews.Author: N. Ho Koon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my vacation to the US specifically because of its ability to record in HD while being both shock and waterproof, and extremely portable; I don't think there's another camera like that out on the market!It takes excellent pictures and video on the ground, in water and in the air! It has an aerial photography setting which really forces the focus to stay at infinity; I've never had a camera that has that option!The problems that I have with this camera however are:- Proprietary battery - I'm accustomed to owning cameras that use AA or AAA batteries since you could just switch batteries if they die- No manual focus- No manual shutter/aperture control- A bit slow to react

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: P. Baker "satisfied customer"
Reviews.Content: We lost our last camera when it accidently went overboard off the kayak with me.  This camera has been nice because it is very compact, still takes high quality pictures, and I don't have to be anxious about it when we're kayaking and exploring the beach.

Reviews.Title: Leaked and dead
Reviews.Author: G. Wolf
Reviews.Content: Owned for 2 months - survived a trip to Mexico, in the ocean and pools, no problem, but the next time I used it in water (in a 3 foot deep pool), it leaked, - camera suddenly turned off and I saw fog on the inside of the lens. After drying, I checked the seal, opened the battery compartment, water drops everywhere.I had a 10megapixel Olympus, which I took down to 50 feet while diving, never had an issue with leakage. Panasonic did not get it right with this one, with their seals.Going to contact the manufacturer, see what they say on a return...such a pain in the neck, even if they do come through on a replacement.My suggestion, if you want a waterproof camera, is buy an Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Michael B. Harris
Reviews.Content: Bought to suppliment my DSLR and it is a great addition. Focus, tracking and picture quality are very good.Oh and drop it or dunk it in a stream and keep taking pictures. Freaking fantastic in the rain too. Goes places I would never dream of taking out my DSLR and then I get to take great looking pictures.

Reviews.Title: any recommendations for SDHC card?
Reviews.Author: J. Fong
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple months now and have used it at three different beaches in and out of water.  It has held up admirably! With temperature changes, the camera lens does tend to fog up a bit. Sometimes a simple wipe across the lens cover works, but other times the build-up is inside and there's not much you can do except dry it off and let it sit with the battery door open for a bit. I think this is most noticeable when there are big differences in water and air temperatures! (duh!)anyways, it's been great and the video is fantastic. it's strange why the video seems to come out so impressive, but the pictures seem to be relatively at par or just a few hairs below normal point-and-shoot cameras. though, for waterproof/shockproof units, it is head and shoulders above the rest.One problem I had when I first purchased the unit is that the video function would keep stopping. It meant sometimes I could only take 15 sec clips and other times maybe 3-4 minutes.  It was hard to tell why that happened, but now I'm always a bit afraid that it's going to turn off in the middle of a recording and so am not prone to leave the unit recording (i.e. on a tripod) without having to constantly keep checking on it.  It seems to be better now, but I'm still a bit nervous about that.  Anyone else have this problem?Other thing is that I bring a big ziploc bag with me when I travel to soak the camera in freshwater after I've been in the ocean (this is recommended in the manual). It keeps salt deposits from building up in the nooks and crannies (i.e. around the buttons and openings) when the seawater dries off.I had a quick question for other owners about recommending SDHC cards.I want to take as long and continuous HD video footage as possible with this camera.1) What is the largest card and what speed do you recommend (class 4? class 6? 15mb/s?)?2) What is the maximum length of time you have been able to record in one clip? (I want to be able to record a 1-4 hour series of presentations without having to constantly check the camera.)I recommend the camera to anyone who wants to take good portable videos (we're talking much better than youtube - but you have to find a good converter to go from MTS to other formats) and needs the ruggedness this unit offers!  All in all, I'd buy it again without hesitating!

Reviews.Title: waterproof fail
Reviews.Author: C. Alexander "DC"
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera for a couple of years until it leaked. It only went on 1-2 trips a year so, it is not over used by any means. I was always very careful with the doors to keep out water/dust/sand, etc. But, no use, it eventually gave out and is now ruined. Not sure how it is leaking, the seals have always looked clean and solid, but somehow it's leaking. I don't think our current technology has fully developed to accomodate a water/shock proof feature for under a few hundred bucks. I was hoping this camera was more durable than a few trips.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Josh Obudzinski
Reviews.Content: Use this camera everywhere and for everything.  It is great.  My daughter has dropped it and we bring it in the pool the ocean, nothing is stopping it.  Just need to make sure to rinse it off after a day of fun and let it air dry but great purchase overall.

Reviews.Title: TS 4
Reviews.Author: Louis Rothman
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  The TS 4 was substituted for the TS 1.  Much newer version. I would reccomend this camera for the novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: Four years later, still going strong
Reviews.Author: B. Sanger
Reviews.Content: After four years with the TS1, I thought about getting a new waterproof/shockproof camera lately and even sampled one of the newer Panasonic Tough models. In the end, decided to keep chugging along with this oldie but goodie. It is still waterproof and shockproof and takes better pictures than the TS5 from Panny. The newer models have a lot more bells and whistles - WiFi, GPS, colorful little menus - but in the end, it's about picture quality for me. This baby has been used extensively on trips to Aruba, Mexico, Ireland, Egypt, Nevis and a lot of domestic trips as well. In the water, on the beach, mountains, jungles, horseback, camelback and it still hums along just fine. The only complaint we've ever had about it is that the sun can mess with the video, causing lines in your recordings. However, I simply try to avoid those situations when recording video now. Guess I'll keep going with it until it breaks down.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Vance Richards
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, easy to use in all modes and the quality of the pictures are great.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Why do I love it!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I use my iPhone for most pics these days, but to be able to zoom, and more importantly, get it wet, this baby takes excellent pics, is durable, and yes, I have used it in, around and under the water successfully.  For these reasons, there is still a place of a point and shoot camera in my life.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my son when he went in the Navy
Reviews.Author: tim smith
Reviews.Content: Great camera, heavy duty, water resistant, he has been using it to get some great memories. If you know someone that is hard on camera equipment, this is the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for hiking/adventures
Reviews.Author: J. Coon
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take nice pictures on a trip to Costa Rica, and didn't want to carry around a big camera... this one did the job just fine! Takes great pictures, and the Sunset mode takes very cool pictures of the sky. I have one 30" picture hanging on my wall

Reviews.Title: I would get this camera over and over again!
Reviews.Author: Sonya
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for New Year's 2010. The first place I brought it was into Mammoth Cave National Park on the wild cave tour. I was told most cameras get damaged while crawling, and if not then, when trying to take a photo getting filled with dust. My camera did not have that problem. I got quality photos in the cave and because of the water proof features it also kept the dust out.Next, I took this camera to Key West four months later, where I snorkled with it. I again took many quality photos while under water.Two months later I took it into the Atlantic Ocean in NJ, pools in St. Petersburg, and teh Gulf of Mexico and the camera still works perfectly fine.I've "dropped" the camera numerous times to show others how awesome it was...and it still is awesome.HOWEVER, I cracked my screen showing off. :o( The camera still takes AWESOME pics, I just need to replace the small piece of glass in front of the camera.I would recommend this camera to anyone, and I will definitely buy another one when this one is gone...which doesn't look like it will be for awhile.

Reviews.Title: durable, with pretty good quality of image
Reviews.Author: C. Koontz
Reviews.Content: This camera has withstood several seasons in the desert and mountains. My only issue is with the zoom. It claims to be an optical zoom, and yet the resolution seems to get way worse when zooming in.

Reviews.Title: My beach camera
Reviews.Author: My First Underwater Camera
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera with right pixels and rugged for underwater photography for my Miami trips and the pools.I got just that and the images came real good. Had to read the quick start guide and the detailed manual for optimally utilising the features available.

Reviews.Title: Took on Cruise and to Mexico
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2009 to take on a cruise to Mexico and again to the beaches of South Carolina in 2010. It has performed great as an all around camera and camcorder. Picture is is decent not great, but if you know how to use photo editing software then the images can look fantastic with just minimal adjustments.  As for the water resistance, once again the TS1 was great - I used the TS1 underwater in pools taking photos and recording video as well as in the ocean at Tulum, Cozumel, and Playa del Carmen, Mexico with no issues at all. As for preventing the TS1 from being damaged from water, you MUST (as with any waterproof electronic device) FOLLOW instructions. It was a great buy in my opion, because you do get 720p HD video recording and the ability to zoom while recording. Incredible features for the price versus many other cameras.4 Stars(instead of 5) only because of photo quality versus price paid and I would have liked better photo shooting in darkness. However, other features such as variable zoom distance depending on image resolution and the HD video recording could push it to 5 stars arguably.

Reviews.Title: This camera is not waterproof. Stopped working after one use.
Reviews.Author: Linda Lam
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I brought this camera to our Cancun vacation. The first day it was fine when we used it in the pool for a little while. On the second day, it stopped working after a few shots. It turned out that water had leaked into the camera! The color on the pictures that we took had too much blue in it and turned all the faces blue. This is not a good camera at all. I am very upset that I wasted so much money on this one!

Reviews.Title: Loved it when it worked, but should have lasted longer before leaking
Reviews.Author: ks
Reviews.Content: Owned it and used it camping and underwater for about 2 years.  Then one day, without warning and without any visible signs of wear or dust in the seals, it leaked water inside, permanently destroyed.  I think it should have lasted longer, particularly since it was quite expensive, i cared for it as instructed and visually it looked as good as the day i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Not sure how they can sell as waterproof
Reviews.Author: NJB
Reviews.Content: Made it on two snorkling trips. On the trip it developed a leak. Expensive mistake. I should have went with the Canon. And listened to all the reviews on Amazon. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Leaked
Reviews.Author: B. Dudley
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Panasonic Lumix branded cameras, but this one was a disappointment.  The controls are a little awkward, but I wrote that off since what I wanted was a water proof camera.  I guess I still want a water proof camera since this one leaked through the battery door and the camera is now ruin.

Reviews.Title: Ok as long as you don't get it wet!
Reviews.Author: Dr. P. R. Stauffer "eldoggo"
Reviews.Content: second water vacation.;  First day.  Snorkeling and staying close to surface. Camera stopped working.  $200 to exchange!!!!  The camera is just over a year old and had very little water exposure. Trash.  Nice heavy build quality and probably OK for mist next to a water fall but do not plan to swim with it- NOT A GOOD CAMERA FOR WATER.

Reviews.Title: average photos, lasted less than two vacations
Reviews.Author: scott greenberg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year and a half ago.  went surfing in costa rica.  video was extremely shaky and unsuable when on a surfboard- en with stabilization on, but it survived the trip.I just came to the virgin islands and went snorkeling. camera stopped working after 10 minutes and I was staying on the surface- maybe the camera went down to 3 feet.build quality seem really good but it is a terrible waterproof camera. Pictures and video average.  But if the camera can't really handle the water then it isn't really worth buying- not the camera I would use for dry land pictures and definitley will not be buying another one of these for the water.  Haven't contacted the company but I am sure The cost to fix it will be prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: My constant outdoor companion!
Reviews.Author: A. Fandl "classics nerd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last summer (2010) to take on kayaking trips.  It's wonderful!  I am just your average point-and-shoot amateur, and it suits me perfectly.  The quality of the photos is amazing, and it definitely is waterproof.  I recommend getting a floating wrist strap for it though: recently my kayak capsized and the camera had not been directly attached to the boat, but the bright orange floating strap ensured that I easily retrieved it from the swift current.  After it had been floating downstream, fully submerged, for about 5 minutes, it worked just as well as before my boat had overturned.  I was able to upload all the photos like normal, and I can't even tell that it took a tumble in the river!

Reviews.Title: Plain  Great!!
Reviews.Author: Eugene Brana
Reviews.Content: This is one of these thing that I consider a must for traveling. Quality of the pictures are great (Not perfect) camera size is exactly the size that you need for portability and handeling. Beside, water, and shock proof what else is needed?

Reviews.Title: This is a great outdoors companion camera
Reviews.Author: Trapshooter "UncleGuido"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 1 ½ years ago, primarily for photos taken from a Kayak.  I have shot well over  1000 pictures with this camera and I have not been disappointed with its performance.  It has been in the duck blind, the pheasant field, the ocean for underwater pictures, and on the ski hill during snowstorms.  It weathers everything and takes good pictures.  It has been dropped, dunked, taken into salt water, and it still works like a charm.  It works in freezing cold temperatures and scorching hot climates.The construction is very rugged, and despite the use/abuse I have given to it, it looks nearly new.  Most importantly for a waterproof camera, it has not leaked.My kayaking takes me both in salt and fresh water.  In the summer I kayak a lot on and near Lake Tahoe, and the waves frequently break over the bow.  I keep this camera in the pocket of my PFD (lifevest), and it routinely gets wet, even drenched. When it is wet, you have to be careful to get the drops off the lens, because this will mess up the shot.  Other than that, the camera controls are easy to manipulate, and they are intuitive.

Reviews.Title: This thing is a champ
Reviews.Author: Manuel Altamirano Jr. "Manuel Altamirano"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and is an all around great camera to have around. After breaking 2 previous cameras due to sand getting into them; this one is just a perfect care-free solutoin. The wide-angle is perfect for self portraits and tight spaces.

Reviews.Title: Seals are failing
Reviews.Author: Pablo509 "paulf509"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a year now.  I have taken the camera on 4 trips and the camera has been in salt water perhaps 15 - 20 times.  I only snorkel so the camera has never been deeper than 5 feet and I rinse and dry the camera after each use.On my last trip. While I was in the water I turned the camera on and noticed the LCD flashing (or flickering).  I turned the camera off and exited the water I took the camera back to my room, rinsed and dried it, and opened it up (took the battery and SD card out).  I played with the camera several more times during the reminder of our trip and the problem seemed to go away.  It appears that one of the seals may have leaked, as the problem is now gone.  I am not confident I can take this back in the water with out replacing all the seals.  I bought this camera expressly for use while snorkeling. I would expect the seals to last longer than a year, especially given the care that I showed the camera (and the price of the camera).As far as picture quality goes, it is average at best. I have a Sony digital camera (8 MP) that I bought in late 2007 or early 2008 that takes better pictures than this Panasonic. The picture quality degrades more in low light situations (like dusk). Given the options available today I would probably choose another brand of waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Outdoors
Reviews.Author: N. Barrett
Reviews.Content: I've had two of these cameras, lost the first one during a snowboard trip in Lake Tahoe (hint: take a picture of your business card so that if you ever lose it someone will hopefully return it to you).  It is a great durable camera that you can take anywhere and shoot anything.  This camera has been with me surfing, snowboarding, and on safari in South Africa and has worked like a champ.  I think picture quality is great for this type of rugged/waterproof camera.  You won't get the picture quality of a high end point and shoot or SLR but I'd rather sacrifice minor picture quality for the ability to take this camera anywhere and capture those moments rather than no pictures at all.  The macro feature is also awesome on this model.  The only negative I have for this camera is the waterproof depth rating (<10ft).  That said, I have never had a problem with the camera leaking.  I definitely recommend this camera and would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Annoying movie format
Reviews.Author: _LARS_
Reviews.Content: Generally like the camera but the videos that it take are in some annoying video format that makes it very hard to get them off of the camera (if you don't use the software that comes with the camera).  Panasonic won't let you download the software after you've bought the camera so if you lose the install disc you are basically screwed with video.

Reviews.Title: Beware!
Reviews.Author: kmtk24
Reviews.Content: I Purchased the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 on 02/3/10 along with the Panasonic marine camera case.  One of the main reasons for purchasing the Lumix DMC-TS1 was the "waterproof" camera itself.  I thought in the seemingly rare case that  the marine housing were to leak  the camera itself would be "waterproof".  I thought I had a good back up plan.  However on a shore dive (only the third vacation of using the Panasonic camera and housing), the housing leaked allowing water in the case.  The shore dive was fairly shallow, no greater than 30 feet.When I returned to the resort from the dive, I quickly removed the camera from the housing that was 1/2 full of water.  I rinsed the camera off with tap water to rid the salt water.  I let the camera air out for 24 hours before reassessing.  I expected the camera to turn on, when it failed to turn on I was shocked.  This is the first time the camera ever came in contact with water and it was while it was in the marine housing.  My brother has a Canon that accidently got wet when his housing leaked and it still works, and it is not advertised as being a "waterproof" camera.So I have two failed pieces of equipment from Panasonic each costing over $200 dollars.  It happens to be 3 weeks over the year warranty.  I have the wonderful opportunity of mailing in the defective equipment (at my cost) and for $45 I can have their technician look at it.  After it has been assessed, a repair fee will be given and thankfully I can apply the $45 dollars to the repair fee.I  have a Sealife camera and marine casing that has never leaked over the years of use.  If you are planning on taking pictures while diving, you might want to consider other cameras.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Waggoner "Waggonab"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are professional photographers.  We take the majority of our photos on vacation with the same camera I use at weddings (Nikon D300s).  It is fantastic.  However, I wanted an underwater camera I could use while snorkeling both for photos and video.  I read through several of the reviews here on Amazon, and decided this had the best HD viedo quality out there.  The first time we used it, it was great!  5 months later we used it again in Mexico, and I started noticing water behind the glass and in front of the lens that was distorting the quality of the video.  Also, there was water behind the lcd screen.  when we returned from our vacation, I immediately contacted Panasonic to replace my camera.  I was happy with how fast they did this.  However, we just recently got back from a cruise in the Caribbean, and the camera didn't work more than 10 minutes before it completely stopped working.  We were able to retrieve what little footage we had, but were unable to use it the remainder of the trip.I contacted Panasonic this time wanting my money back.  I don't think they deserve a third chance.  Needless to say, their customer support has been appalling.  The people themselves haven't been too terrible to work with, but they are obviously given no power to make any type of decision to take care of the customer.  They are simply refusing to refund me my money, and are going to send me yet another camera that I won't even take on vacation with me, because I have no faith in it's reliability.  I will never purchase another Panasonic camera again!!!  Please don't make the same mistake I did.  I purchased this camera from Amazon, and am going to see if they will at least refund me my money if I send back the new camera they send me this time.  I'm not counting on it.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Seals Failed
Reviews.Author: Zara
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed in this camera. I was able to use this camera approximately 10 times and poof! Even following carefully the instructions to avoid water intrusion the water got into the camera. I snorkel in the ocean with a floating vest, so I don't go deep past the established limit of the camera. I also did not like the lag time turning on the camera and between shots. I found it a little hard to see the screen so sometimes I had to guess as to where to point the camera. In the video playback on the computer you can hear the motor of the camera zooming in and out. $200+ wasted. On the positive side I like the look and size of the camera and how easy it was to carry it around and how it fits in your hand. It would help if the buttons where a tad bit more prominent.

Reviews.Title: great camera for travelling/adventure but not for low light shots
Reviews.Author: savera
Reviews.Content: I got this as backup for my Nikon D80 in places where it wasn't easy or convenient to use.  I got it for the fact it's waterproof and shockproof. It's good for taking pictures where there's lots of light, good for outdoors, water activities, etc. but not an ideal camera for low light such as parties. The quality isn't that great but that's not why I purchased this camera so overall I'm happy with it but just wished I could get better pictures in low light.  Compared to other waterproof and shockproof camera, it looks more sleek and stylish and not that bulky.
