Reviews.Title: Decent camera, but not fully waterproof
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: I got one for my brother, and made sure he knew how to care for it before he used it.  The first time he took it to the pool, it worked fine.  The second time, it leaked and broke.  Even within 30 days of buying it, Panasonic wouldn't stand by their product.  Luckily, Amazon came through and took it back.  My brother bought the newer but more expensive TS2, which is much better.  If you're going to get your camera seriously wet, go with the TS2 instead.Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Leaked
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers, this leaked. It worked fine for about a year and then one day it leaked and that was it, despite all the seals being in place. The construction is frustrating because you have HDMI and AV digital inputs, which I imagine few use and it was these ports that were the cause of the leak.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very sturdy!
Reviews.Author: BlueSkieyes
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked pretty well so far. My favorite part about it is the sturdiness--can get wet or go under water, get muddy or sandy, etc. I've dropped it a couple of times on accident and it still works perfectly. I've broken OTHER cameras before just by taking them to the beach and getting a grain or two of salt in the lens, but THIS camera is built like a fortress. And it comes with really sweet photo software, with a feature for making panoramas.My only qualm with this camera is that it does not take good low-light pictures. (But then again, the only brand of point-and-shoot cameras I've seen take good low-light pictures (sans flash) is Canon.) Other than that, a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted and what was advertised
Reviews.Author: Kaya W.
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that was dust and waterproof. I'm very hard on my equipment and this product has been awesome. Its been droppend and taken to the desert with highly alkalai dust, and gone mountaineering and come out perfectly. Dropping it once did put a tiny little dent in the metal housing but that's why it's metal right? Plastic would have surely cracked. The photos are a little soft but being able to get photos realiably is important to me. Battery life is very good. I'm very pleased with the wide angle and it's zoom.This is a camera I would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: sucky
Reviews.Author: Corey Alexander "Corey"
Reviews.Content: quick shipment but arrived broken - do not buy from this seller they refused to answer my emails

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Nija Mashruwala
Reviews.Content: I may have been expecting too much when I got this camera. I found that while I like it, I don't love it like I had expected to.The biggest pros are that it takes great pictures in well-lit settings and most outdoor locations, the video quality is generally quite good, it works extremely well with my computer (a Mac), and that it is very durable and relatively portable. The user interface is a bit nonintuitive, and while the number of camera and light options is good, they aren't always useful. A peculiarity to this model is that I have to hold down the rather small On/Off button for about 2 seconds to get it to turn on, yet only have to tap the button to turn it off.The biggest cons are the amount of noise, the color quality in lower light or indoor pictures, and that the back screen gets scratched and smudged when I keep it in my purse. Accurate color correction on my computer (I use iPhoto) is generally hard to do for low-light pictures because of the poor color information and amount of noise. Minor issues for me are that it connects to my computer via USB but doesn't charge through it, and that it is often uncomfortable to hold.I haven't tested the water resistance or the seals. Even though battery life hasn't been a problem, I plan to buy an extra battery to keep charge and swap out when I need to, just in case. Overall, I am happy with the camera, but do feel that it is over-priced for what it does. If I were to purchase a similar camera now, I'd seriously consider the DMC-TS2, which wasn't out when I bought my camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for the beach!
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I bought it about 4 months ago and have taken it in the ocean, the swimming pool, etc.  I haven't noticed any leaks and it still works as well as it did the day we got it. The picture quality is great for a point and shoot.The only issue I have is that the LCD screen scratches easily.  I've never dropped it but I have had it in our beach bag with sand, coral, rocks, etc. and the LCD screen has quite a few scratches on it.  It's not really an issue to me because it doesn't affect the pictures, but I know it might bother some people.

Reviews.Title: Wide angle on land or at sea
Reviews.Author: sun state
Reviews.Content: Excellent vacation camera on land or at sea, incredible video,Wide angle lenses A+.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected - great "active Dad" camera
Reviews.Author: P. Burke
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after having gone through a series of brands and styles of digital cameras over the years.  I found I was doing more and more short video clips of the kids, so I wanted a camera that would take high def video and good birthday and wedding kind of photos, but also a camera that I could take fishing or boating and not worry about it getting damp.  After lugging around a lot of camera bags, I also wanted something that would easily go into a jacket pocket.I really wasn't looking at Panasonic, but in searches and reviews this camera just kept coming up over and over.  Being on the higher end of the cost range in relation to stated features, I got this with some trepidation, but I've had this camera for about 4 months, I've taken hours and hours of video and thousands of photos, and I have to say it has been a great buy.  I have taken a few underwater photos, just to see if it worked, but I don't think I'd take it diving....overall, I have no regrets.The Pros:Great video and picture quality.Very good battery life and reasonably priced extra batteries.Shock proof - I have "tested" this feature on more than one occasion.Video screen quality.Very good image stabilizationPre-set "scene" modes that make sense and actually work.Relatively easy to use menus and buttons.The Cons:No view finder...not really a con once you get used to it and battery life is good even with the big screen on all the time.The outer metal case is tough, but it dents and scratches pretty easily, more cosmetic than anything else.The recessed lens is great for shockproofing....hard to clean.Fair to adequate sound quality.  This is really the biggest con.  Given how nice the video quality is, the lacking sound quality is really an issue.

Reviews.Title: The coloring was off on this camera
Reviews.Author: D. Beck
Reviews.Content: My brother and I both ordered this camera.  The color on my camera was off and all the pictures had a blue tint to them.  My brothers pictures came out great though.  I had to return my camera because I did not care for the coloring at all.The service from Amazon was excellent!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Colorado skier
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 4 months now and have tested it in several countries and a few oceans.  This camera's metal body feels very strong.  I've even dropped it from 5 feet onto a hard floor and no damage at all.  The waterproofness is excellent also.  I've been snorkeling in the ocean several times and never had a leak.  The seals still look brand new.  This camera's been wet and dusty.  Not a problem for it.  I thought the lack of a lens cover would be an issue with scratching and it turns out not to be the case.  I had a Samsung waterproof camera with a movable lens cover and I returned the camera for several reasons.  One of which was the cover would jam with just a little bit of sand or dirt.  The Panasonic does not have this problem.The underwater photos are of acceptable quality.  The biggest issue is finding water that is really clear to start with to make great photos.The video feature I use a LOT.  I then edit the video on my MacBook and make DVD's with it.  The finished product is very nice and all my friends have loved their videos.My only complaint is this...  The included software for the panoramic picture processing does not work very well with my Mac.  It's a downright pain in the kartukis.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA--- and can withstand my hard knocks.
Reviews.Author: S. Lindquist
Reviews.Content: AWESOME CAMERA--- and can withstand my hard knocks. This camera is great.  It is the fourth 'pocket' zoom I have bought.  --- I carry it on my belt, at work, outside... - the last two cameras were broken thru my tough use, and dropping...I gave it 4 stars on picture quality, only because it does not have as good a lens as my previous Lumix 10x zoom... pocket camera... -- but that camera was larger and had a lens that extended, so I would expect better photos...For a tough camera... this one is great....I would buy it, again... hopefully, I won't have to!

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof
Reviews.Author: JasonHanley
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality, and excellent HD video.Bad design. Case is not waterproof, as claimed.As many reviews state (see also DMC-FT1 -- same camera) the camera stops working after a few underwater trips.I was lucky enough to get about 5 or 6 snorkeling runs with it, but on the last one, I snapped two shots, and it was done.This is basically a very expensive disposable underwater camera.Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: cruise camera
Reviews.Author: Darrell A. Johnson "Eagle Hunter"
Reviews.Content: I did my homework and it paid off. I love this camera as did all the people that saw me use it on my recent seven day cruise. I put a floating strap on it just in case I droped it while snorkeling in the deep and it worked great. My pictures look professional above and below the water. The movie mode is great and very easy to use. This thing is small enough to slip into your pocket while dressed in a suit and tough enough that it did great on the zip line in Isla Roatan. People would ask me if it was waterproof as I was about to put it in the water, that was my time to brag on my new camera. I took over 400 shots with this thing in all conditions and never had to delete a picture because it was bad. My desktop picture on my computer looks like one from National Geo. but I took it with my Lumix DMC-TS1 12mp. Our pictures were only missing one thing... a sitting fee from a professional photographer, the results are the same. To say the least I AM IMPRESSED. My kids 14 and 11 even took good pictures with this thing. It also did great while tubing in a cave in complete darkness. Love it! Glad I got to review it. But most of all glad it is mine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bigdeezs
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great photos even compared to non-underwater cameras. I havent takin it underwater and dont plan to. My last camera broke from sand damage and I got this one to make sure that doesn't happen again. I dont even want to test its water proofness. One thing i hate is that the video is taken is either .mov or avchd formats. Why cant these things just take .MPG or .AVI format. Stupid apple and quicktime nonsense. I end up converting all my videos now...ugh.

Reviews.Title: Major Problem with "Waterproofing"
Reviews.Author: Catherine Hovell
Reviews.Content: We have owned and liked this camera for nearly a year, and had fun with it near and in water on many occasions.  I took it with me this past weekend on an outdoor adventure that was a bit more rugged... and was horrified to look down at some point in the day to see the battery / SIM card door had popped open.  Goodbye, waterproof-ness, and, as I was in water at the time, goodbye, camera.  Fortunately the SIM card was still readable, but the camera is a loss.If you're going to use this camera in wet and rugged situations, you might want to consider taping over the two critical doors.  I have seen rubber sleeves for some other similar cameras, but am unable to find one for this camera... the sleeves help protect those door openers, for sure.  Too bad none are available for this model.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active use
Reviews.Author: Alison
Reviews.Content: We have gone through a number of cameras as we are active and take them with us.  After the last one was ruined by water again I did some research and discovered this one.  Have used it now on two vacations and love it.  Very durable and waterproof on the boat!  Doesn't matter if it gets splashed while taking fun pictures.  The speed burst fuction is great and you can catch some fun shots.  You just have to be willing to go back and sort through a TON of pictures to find the ones you want to keep since it takes so many.  The batter life is not as long as I would have liked so I purchased a second battery to keep on hand.

Reviews.Title: Top notch images even if it's a water camera
Reviews.Author: John Ss "Johnny S"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for our Great Barrier Reef Trip, where we did 3 days of snorkeling in up to 10ft of water.  The camera performed with no complaints.  We've now had this camera 5 months and are quite happy using as our every day point and shoot.Pros:The images are very sharp and colors are vibrant.Camera use is very easy with many shooting modes including food, face, pet, panoramic, etc.Not bad shutter lag in low light situations.Very sturdy and durable.Cons:It may be Panasonic, and a little nitpicky, but the push button feel and sound selection of the clicks are electronicky and seem cheap.

Reviews.Title: i'm happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Locutus
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really nice pictures for its price ($228) and it's even water proof. I wouldn't suggest anyone to submerge it under water because I've heard about all the problems ppl were getting but at least it can take some water spills with no problem.

Reviews.Title: My second and probably not my last Lumix
Reviews.Author: S. Zemlo
Reviews.Content: First off... for all you people complaining about the AVCHD format... here's a converter that works very well if you don't have decent editing software.[...]This camera does everything it says it does. I know there is a lot of discussion about just how waterproof it is or isn't, but I gotta say... mine has worked just fine from kayaking, to pool parties, to swimming in the ocean.  I did get a little fog inside the lens at the beach, which probably isn't a good thing, but it went away and still works just fine.  I think as long as you are very thorough when checking the seals before you close it when changing the battery or SD card, it will be as waterproof as they advertise.  Now I'm not ruling out the possibility of defects. So I guess it may be a lottery situation like with many electronic devices.As far as picture and video quality... obviously not the BEST, but definitely great for what the camera is designed for and the price.  The pictures are a little washed out sometimes (not all the time), and the audio on the video is definitely lacking (once it's gone underwater your lucky to hear anything unless you tip it upside down and tap the water out of the mic holes), but considering digital cameras this size even 5 years ago shot medium quality video (at best), it is a very good camera.Obviously there will be improvements in the world of compact waterproof cameras in the years to come, but for right now, I don't think you can ask for anything better for this price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: LgT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for its ruggedness and underwater capability. Did extensive research and decided this camera offered the best combination of image quality, features, and design out of all the "rugged" cameras I looked at. I already own a Nikon D40 DSLR and several lenses for the times when I need serious image quality and flexibility, but if I'm going to trade off capability for portability with a compact camera, it would be nice to get some new capabilities in exchange, and this camera delivers.Image quality is decent for a compact. Not anywhere as good as a DSLR, but certainly better than a lot of Sony and Olympus models I looked at, which smudge every last ounce of fine detail into what looks like a water painting. I usually shoot mine at the 5MP setting to save on memory capacity, and I don't see much difference between this and the 12MP resolution. There's just no way this tiny lens and sensor will capture 12MP worth of detail, not even close to my 6MP DSLR. The bonus of this option is the extended zoom feature, which uses only the center portion of the sensor, thus allowing me to zoom in closer without degradation in image quality, unlike regular digital zoom.Some other notable features I like:-relatively fast auto-focus for a compact-usable zoom range, starting at a moderately wide 28mm equivalent focal length-optical image stabilization-easy exposure compensation-"intelligent exposure" to tame the highlights and shadows in high contrast scenes-macro shooting-adjustable white balance (no fluorescent preset, but can set custom WB using a white/gray card)-variety of scene modes, including long exposure and lower-rez high speed burst (about 7fps)-dedicated button for HD video recording with optical zooming and image stabilization-nice-looking design, doesn't resemble a plastic toy cameraThe waterproof capability seems to hold up just fine. I submerged the camera in my sink, and saw no problems. Also took it on a wet and wild boat ride where it got splashed with salt water as I was filming video, then washed it off under a faucet when I got home, and the camera performed without a hiccup.Overall, I'm fairly happy with this camera, and the price is very reasonable for the capabilities it offers. In fact, it spoiled me, and I would not buy any other compact camera unless it offered at least the same kind of ruggedness and features.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Fat Daddy
Reviews.Content: Love the hi res videos this camera produces. It makes some internal noises that can be loud when playing your video back. I haven't tested it in water yet. But the sound is super, the picture is amazing, and it slips into a pocket. I gave the portability a four, because the lens placement is in a precarious spot. I often put my fingers across it, and have to be conscious of it while shooting. I ordered the back up battery, so I never run out of time.

Reviews.Title: Very decent.
Reviews.Author: Cat Tree
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, especially for the price. Quality photos. Good lens. The under water feature works well. The camera is pretty and sturdy, the software smart enough and the AI setting works well. Video was better than expected. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket Camera.
Reviews.Author: MTRCTYLARRY
Reviews.Content: Great little pocket/travel Camera. Pictures are very clear and crisp. Only wish it had a little more zoom.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but...
Reviews.Author: Becky Sue
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera as a gift, and it functions well, but the focus motor broke about 2 weeks after receiving it. I hope Panasonic will replace the camera with a new one, not one that's been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: worked great but NOT waterproof!
Reviews.Author: amberuna
Reviews.Content: I really loved this camera and had it over a year. I took it to the beach and it worked great in the water, but a year later when I took it in the pool I double checked that all the compartments were secure but water still made its way into the battery compartment and the camera was ruined. However, I really did love the camera up to that point. I do think it takes great pictures and I am sad that I can't use it anymore. I just want to let everyone know that the 2nd time I used the camera in the water it did not proove to be completely waterproof. Next time I want a waterproof camera I am going to splurge for the Sony DSC-T900 and the MPK-THH Marine Pack. My father has this and it works great!

Reviews.Title: Lumix Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Helix
Reviews.Content: Most fun I've ever had with a camera - playing in and below the surf and no worries of water on the camera.  Nice video, good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Easy-to-use.  Good all-round camera.
Reviews.Author: ambric
Reviews.Content: We have had a few Casio Exilim cameras before this one as carry-with-you snapshot devices.  Those were slim and inexpensive, but one died due to a drop in shallow water and the other due to a drop onto concrete.  Those experiences made the Panasonic's water- and shock-proof claim attractive.  We used it on a mission trip to Southern Texas and I will not go back to Casio.  The picture quality is notably better, especially the outdoor pics.  We took it in the ocean and captured some really great video, too.  I like the "iA" feature which automatically selects a scene mode based on what the camera sees.  It works pretty well for most conditions and helps you get good shots without having to mess with settings.  The start-up time is also very good.  Taken together, these features mean I could whip it out and grab a shot at a moment's notice (which is important in a snapshot camera).  My favorite feature, though, is the wider angle lens.  I was really surprised how much more you can fit in a shot with it.  It actually takes some getting used to as you have to either move closer or use the (very adequate) zoom to get close enough to see people's faces.  It's much better than the old "scoot in a little closer" while backing up to try to get everything in the picture.  The menu setup is pretty intuitive, too, unlike some cameras I've played with (like an Olympus which was terrible).  Overall, I am very pleased with the camera and would say the extra cost was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Good quality if you want a tough camera
Reviews.Author: Susan I. Spark "swim with da fishes"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocket size camera that could be knocked around a bit (e.g. clumsy, outdoors person).  This camera is quite good for that.  Its "baptism" was on a tubing trip in Texas, and it was submerged rather a lot without issue.It isn't necessarily great for distance pictures if you want to try and zoom in a bit.  What surprised me is the amazing quality of macro shots.  I did not expect that, but it is exactly the type of picture I love taking.  I can use full zoom within a few inches of the subject, and the detail is impressive.I will be going to Hawaii in a few weeks and am thrilled to have this camera.  To be honest, it will not be my main camera.  But it is a great accessory camera and to bring along when a bigger camera is too big or delicate to risk.  It will be far more maneuverable than the "underwater bag" I used last time for my larger Canon.If you do not need a sturdy camera, there are far better options.  The feature of this is really that it takes decent pictures and you don't have to worry about it getting beaten up.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the beach
Reviews.Author: BC
Reviews.Content: Good quality pictures, decent video.  Great substitution when conditions are too hazardous for my dSLR.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera if you can hang on to it!!
Reviews.Author: Michelle S. Peters "Michigan Angler"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Lumix DMC-TS1 in January 2010 to use when we go fishing.  I wanted a camera that not only could take digital pictures, but one that was waterproof.  I used the camera successfully for 5 months until it was stolen on our fishing trip last week in Northern Michigan.  I am still upset that someone would take or find something that is not theirs.  They got a great camera!I liked how easy it was to use and the quality of the pictures.  I never had a chance to use it underwater or take video.I just ordered another Lumix replacement, but upgraded to the DMC-TS2.  We shall see how well this camera works.

Reviews.Title: Best possible camera for that price
Reviews.Author: Chancho Salvaje "Chancho Salvaje"
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera. The underwater performance is great. I used for a shooting a video about rivers and combining the underwater videos with a Canon's 7D footage was seamless. The quality of the lenses is really good.

Reviews.Title: Good 2nd camera to SLR
Reviews.Author: Richard D. Roth Jr. "Sujost"
Reviews.Content: I have used a full size DSLR for years but can't always cary it.  This is a sturdy camera with very good image quality.  Check out [...] and [...] for un biased reviews.  This camera comes in the top two for water/shock proof units.  So far I really like it and haven't had my SLR out since I bought this because it's always with me now.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value!
Reviews.Author: Jim Hern "jimbohio"
Reviews.Content: I am a video producer and this unit just saved me THOUSANDS of dollars by allowing me very good quality images above AND below water!!! In addition, I did NOT have to lug all sorts of equipment, just this little camera that fits in my pocket or around my wrist! BRAVO Panasonic!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera - perfect for snorkel
Reviews.Author: Katydid "Katy"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our big trip to South America.  We particularly wanted an underwater camera for use in the Galapagos.  The camera is easy to use with one hand.  Although the water was murky at time, it took great pictures.  The stablizer was good for pictures taken while we were in the zodiac going to and from the boat.  We didn't have to worry about getting wet.  The only negative I can think is that we had a challenge to keep our fingers away from the lenses.  We took lots of video and pictures - the battery would hold up for an entire day of many shots.  It recharged quickly when needed.  I am so glad we have this camera.  It fits in a pocket or slips into the fanny pack.  Great little camera.Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 12MP Digital Camera with 4.6x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Orange)

Reviews.Title: Durable
Reviews.Author: D. Burns "DKB"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera right before a family trip to the Dominican,  We took over 500 photos and additional 30 videos.  The camera performed flawlessly.  It was used in and around the ocean, beach, and pool.  Simply rinsed it off with water, and wiped it dry with a cotton beach towel.  The added bonus was the kids using it to take underwater pictures in the pool.  It kept them busy for hours.  With the editing software that came with the camera, it was easy to crop and personalize the pictures.  The only problem that we have had is the format for the video.  I couldn't just save it and play it.  Probably my lack of technical savy.  I feel the camera is worth every penny I spent on it, and would recommend it to anyone looking to have a compact camera they can throw in their pocket and really take almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Takes beautiful pictures with loads of optional settings!
Reviews.Author: Z. Marine
Reviews.Content: I've had to throw away my last two cameras because of recurring lens errors due to dust getting in the optics, so I bought this camera as a way to end that annoying cycle.  Having said that, I was quite taken by surprise at how great this camera is!  I haven't tested its underwater or shock-absorbing capabilities, but the pictures it takes are gorgeous!  On top of that, there are oodles of settings you can use to adjust things how you want (specifying ISO, aperture time, red-blue color settings, white balance, etc.).  For an amateur, there's definitely more than enough options to meet your wildest wishes.  Add to that the fact that the camera is beautiful and I really couldn't recommend it more.  But if it has a lens error in a year I'm coming back and writing the most scathing review imaginable.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually taken this under the water as yet but in six months on terra-firma (up mountains, in the baby's mouth, in sub-zero conditions, on boats with spray)this is a great performer that you don't need to worry about. That's what I was after a rugged camera that I could take anywhere.Plus the HD video is better than from my Flip Camera.Impressive.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic created a winner
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Warrick "<><"
Reviews.Content: Best little camera I ever bought.  Great picture quality.  Hi-def video is beautiful and always in focus.  I take it mountain biking and hiking.  It never disappoints.  I love being able to not worry about it.  I filmed Shamu while getting soaked!  Great stuff to share with others.  The only complaints are that the record button for video is so small you can't work with ski gloves and the zoom control is very stiff.  Other than that, I love to show off my cool indestructable camera.  Plus the orange looks way cool.  No regrets!

Reviews.Title: blurry photos
Reviews.Author: Cicero
Reviews.Content: Bought based upon good reviews, but the camera takes blurry photos unless you are _absolutely_ still. Thought it might be this unit so went to a store and tested theirs, same result.Can't return it but wife bought an Olympus - I plan to EBay this one.

Reviews.Title: Shadow to the left?????
Reviews.Author: J. S. Gideon
Reviews.Content: Got this camera on Friday and noticed that indoor shooting with a flash leaves a shadow or shaded outline to the left of the person or object I am taking a picture of.  Does anyone know how to resolve this?  If I cant fix it I am sending it back.  Other than that I have no complaints of this camera.  Outdoor pictures are great.  I havent tried submerging it yet due to the warranty limitations.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Navi
Reviews.Content: I originally swore by the canon digital elf cameras, as I hadn't found a pocketable one that had nearly as good quality for my lighting conditions, and my uses. However, my canon's keep breaking, partially because I let my kids take pictures, and occasionally they get dropped (usually it's a lens error), or one time my son snitched it and dropped it in his water table. I had researched the cannon waterproof/shockproof camera, and found reviews on cnet.com for other, similar cameras. This one appeared to be the best overall, bsed on the review. I found it here on Amazon and purchased it. I've taken quite a few pictures with it and am very pleased. One thing I like better than my old canon cameras, is that the flash doesn't seem as powerful, so I don't end up with whitewashed pictures. Getting the video to work was a little tricky, but then I didn't read the user manual. ;)

Reviews.Title: Love it so far.
Reviews.Author: DanC
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'll submit this now even though I have not yet used all aspects of the camera, like the video option.  So keep that in mind.  Anyway, I have a Pentax DSLR and it's great.  But sometimes you just don't want to carry it and the lenses around.  So with an excursion to Chicago coming up I gave in and bought the TS1.  Due to my bad habits of kayaking, sailing, cycling and just being outside a whole lot it had to be a water resistant ("proof" is a big word) camera.  This seemed to be the best combination of protection from the elements, portability, and picture quality for me.  I hate tons of menus, "options", and clicking!  Good for me that a short go over of the instructions was all I needed to get on my way.  I found the menus easy to deal with and sensible when I wanted them.  First time using it was in Chicago walking around at night.  I had read some bad reviews on low light performance from this camera so oh well I thought.  Holy cow the pics looked amazing!  Now this is in the city with lit up buildings and such but still night.  The detail and evenness across the photos really surprised me, in a good way.  These were all taken hand held so we can assume the motion stabilization works well.  Color was also excellent.  Next day, cold as crap but full sun.  Again the pics look great.  The viewer was easy to see even with the bright day.  Also did well at a snowy mountain bike race later on.  Fun.  Inside was good as well.  I did find the auto white balance seemed to have some trouble with some types of lighting.  But this is not a big deal in my opinion.  One it was not that bad, and I put my pics into the computer and can doctor them some anyway.  A little tweaking and they look just right.  I do this with my DSLR too by the way, I'm sure most of us do.  One big factor for me; this camera has a wider lens than some of the others, 28 rather than 35mm.  You won't be sorry you've got the wider angle.  I found the camera to be very user friendly.  Of course I read the reviews and wondered about all the negative things that where said.  But remember the reviews were overwhelmingly positive.  Also I think some people tend to compare it to a thousand dollar DSLR or something. Well it's not that.  Remember, we want to carry it in our pockets and call them "point and shoots".  Short is I love this thing so far.  It's a lot of easy to carry and use fun and looks great.  Sorry to not have got in under water or used the video yet, maybe we'll expound on that later.  Thumbs up for now.

Reviews.Title: tct2
Reviews.Author: tct2 "tct2"
Reviews.Content: I have had my TS1 for about a week now, and i am very impressed with the quality. I wanted a camera I could take with me anywhere and not have to worry about breaking it. So far I am impressed with the picture quality granted my last camera was a nikkon cool pix 5 mp and this camera shoots much better as it should. I have shot some HD video with the camera and it has turned out great. I read that the camera will write to an sd card at 17 mb/s. I bought an 8gb SDHC class 2 card which will hold about 1100 pictures at the highest setting. My only question is if the class 2 card is limiting my HD recording capabilities as far as quality? Could anyone answer this for me? The only quall I have about this camera is that there is no lens cover wrather hardened glass, which I would not want to put to the test, because if that scratches all your pictures will show it. I was stuck between this camera and the Casio Ex-1, I chose this camera because I previously had the Casio camera phone, granted it was only 5 mp but the image quality was horrible so I went with the TS1 and am very glad I did so. Overall Great Camera and would recommend it to anyone especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: James P. Rivers "JR"
Reviews.Content: Have not be able to take underwater phot's yet but so far the picture quality and ease of use has been fantastic. The wide angle lenes allows for a great view of the whole gang!Will be taking it on a cruise in June and will report on underwater capabilities....

Reviews.Title: Two words: THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Umalib
Reviews.Content: I've dropped my camera twice already (clumsy queen!) and have not had any problems with the it. Still need to try the water feature.Great pictures. STURDY, just perfect for me. LOVED the color.The manual says that it might not work properly below -10°C, but I used it in a colder weather, and although I did notice that it was making an extra effort to focus objects, the pictures came out great!Thank you Panasonic for building such great products!

Reviews.Title: Excelent for the common user!
Reviews.Author: Willem Schol "wschol"
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera, I read a lot of review's that supported and condemned it. After taking in consideration everything, I made up my mind and bought it. The truth is I'm extremelly happy with my desition. Pictures are great, quality also. It has lots of features and it's very easy to use. I would recommend it to any common day-a-day user, that only want's a good camera to travel with and to use it to remember those trips. For expert's, I really don't know. I'm not, so I don't know what this camera lack's of to satisfy their needs.

Reviews.Title: Met my expectations
Reviews.Author: Juan Z
Reviews.Content: It is the kind of product that I was looking for. Very robust and no problems taking pictures under water. The HD possibility is great. I am happy so far with this product.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Butler
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! It's easy to use and I love all of the great features. My only complaint is that occasionally I get a blurry picture but I think it because I need to change the settings. I'm really happy with this camera, I love it :)

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: riffmaster1998
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when I started using the camera.  I picked this camera over the Canon waterproof because I read that the video capture was in 720P where as the Canon was a lower resolution.  When I started using the video capture, I was really impressed at the clarity and quality of the picture.  The only drawback I found was that the camera could easily scratch when in your pocket with car or house keys.  The colored finishes are very nice also. I have yet to submerse it into water.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: T. Vaite
Reviews.Content: Totally waterproof. I live on an island were there is 90% of humidity in the air, I go to the beach very often with my friends and always have fun moments to capture in videos or pics, so this camera is perfect! Great image and sound quality, easy to use and carry around. I definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: very pleased but a little dissappointed
Reviews.Author: REY
Reviews.Content: this little camera delivers the goods, picture color are very good, other point and shoot camera that i have used, gives me a yellowish color when the flash is utilize, but not this camera. the colors are really good. the battery life don't last long , a camera case is necessary, as the face easily scratch, i think the coating on the face of the camera is not strong , i put the camera in my wife's bag, when i took it out , my new camera is scratch. beside these 2 failings, i would not hesitate to buy this camera again, yes it is a buy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good, but could be better
Reviews.Author: Jonathan T. Sweet
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm pretty happy with the DMC-TS1. It's a capable camera, and I'm hoping the others reviewers issues with failure in the water are just flukes (I haven't gotten mine wet yet). Power does seem to be an issue (ran out of juice after shooting about 50 minutes of video).My biggest peeve is the video capabilities. The software that came with the camera won't work on my Mac, so I've had issues trying to convert the AVCHD movies. You can switch to recording Quicktime movies, but they are limited to 2GB (which is only about 15 minutes of HD Quicktime).This is by no means the best camera I've ever owned. In the end I think it's overpriced for its feature set. Most users would be happier with something else.

Reviews.Title: Big and rugged, but interface is not very good
Reviews.Author: T. C. Ta "Devil Doc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snowboarding trip and then for snorkeling when I go on vacation. It is indeed waterproof, and takes decent pictures, but the interface is horrible! The screen is littered with cryptic icons and menu settings are buried under layers of controls. I would recommend this camera for anyone who wants a rugged camera that can hit the sand, surf, and snow as well as parties, but it's not as slick as Sonys or Canons.

Reviews.Title: Good durable all in one camera
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Caffrey "PAC_review"
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of things, you really cant't have it all in one at a great price and be completely pleased.  This camera come pretty close to what I wanted and needed. I needed something that is small relatively durable and reliable with decent picture quality.  I haven't used it much yet, but so far it seems to be everything I had relisticaly expected. It doesnt have a peep hole to shoot through so the LCD can be a little hard to see if the sun is on it and I do wish the new digital cameras came with a small memory card to use while deciding if the camera is what you want.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jia-ming Lin
Reviews.Content: This is a water, dust, and shock prove camera. You wouldn't expect to see all these functions on the same device years ago, and this is it! It is not super ease to use cause a lot of freedom is there for your own decision. Take pictures in the way you want!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: aj "aj"
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well.  A little spendy, but the image stabilization makes for very high quality pictures.  Video and panoramic modes work well. It is a little bulkier then some digi-cams, but its easy to use and should be very durable, so it should pay off.This camera is much nicer then the Olympus Tough 6000 a friend had.  (Although his does have some added panoramic modes).The only problem I am having is the included software didn't load fully, so I can't work with videos yet.

Reviews.Title: Very nice and highly portable
Reviews.Author: Adam Safier
Reviews.Content: So far I have used this camera for snapshots and have not tested the waterproof function.  Overall it is a very nice camera.I did have to increase the exposure permanently because the default pictures were a little dark.  The shutter button and zoom button are next to each other resulting in occasional confusion when I press the zoom button when I mean to press the shutter.  This is a matter of getting used the setup.  I am fairly used to holding the on button to get the camera going but I wish you had to do the same to turn it off.  A few times I pressed the off button instead of the shutter and turned off the camera.  These are minor issues and a matter of getting used to the tool.The pictures seem sharp but the colors are not as vibrant as I imagined they would be. Still, they are pretty good for a snap shot approach with a really small camera.  The 4.6X Optical Zoom function is smooth and lets me frame shots the way I want them.

Reviews.Title: Nice little point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Lippincott
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 12MP Digital Camera with 4.6x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Green)I just bought this camera in October '09 s a replacement for older point and shoot. I haven't had a chance to explore all of it's capabilities, but it is easy to use. I can't wait to test it out underwater next season. I did try the panorama stitching capability with the software that came with it, and it works quite well, providing a seamless 3-D picture. I like the size too, fits in a pocket or in a small case on the belt. I also have a DSLR, but this camera is nice for when I don't want to lug the big one around. Oh yeah, and the 720p video is a great little feature. Not quite as good as my 1080i Sony HDD camcorder, but more than adequate capture the moment. For the price this is a great camera and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, decent video
Reviews.Author: Aslan
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this camera.  I needed a 'tough camera' after drowning my previous Nikon CoolPix while kayaking.  My requirements were water proof, compact, and can zoom while shooting video.  Of the various tough cameras this, and the cannon, are the only ones that can zoom while shooting video. The cannon is not as compact.  The only drawbacks of this camera are the shutter lag which you get with most all of the point and shoot models and it takes about 1/2 second to start up.  The pictures and video are very good for a point and shoot.  You can even shoot in high definition video mode.  It is not an SLR so don't expect that level of performance, but for what it is, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Roger B. Hansen "Motorcycle golfer"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for harsh conditions. I ride motorcycles a lot and have ruined to many cameras. I think that this will last more than one trip

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Kansas girl
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Quality pictures for a point and shoot.  Worked perfect in the water.  Took it to the beach and worked great.  Great camera to take on vacations...you don't have to worry about it getting wet.  I hooked it on my wrist and carried it everywhere.  Love the features that most of the other point and shoots don't have.  It gives you some options with the flash and adjusting the exposure, which is nice.  Video is also good quality.  Would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Fits well in the hand.  Takes great pictures.  Easy to use right out of the box, but the directions are necessary to take advantage of all the features this camera offers.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures - Still New Though
Reviews.Author: Tim Johnson
Reviews.Content: Have used the camera for 2 1/2 months - it takes great pictures and HD movies.  My teenage daughter used it for a trip to Disneyworld she came back with great pictures and movies of July 4th fireworks.  I've used it for nature photos and people/portrait shots at a family reunion, and it does a great job. We shoot everything in 16 X 9 aspect ration and pictures and HD movies look beautiful on our Panasonic 42" plasma.  (Mini HDMI to standard HDMI cable not included.)  We use a Transcend 16 Gb SDHC card and it's been happy with the card since it was first inserted.  The only reason I didn't give the camera 5 stars is that we have not tried any underwater shots yet...if it works as advertised there, my review will be FIVE stars.  I have no hesitation recommending this camera, although if you don't care about the waterproof capability you can probably find a cheaper camera that takes pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far...
Reviews.Author: Sarah Girard
Reviews.Content: So far I love this camera. I've had it for about a month and have had no problems yet. Everyone loves it and compliments me on the quality of photos and that it's 12MP! Although I must admit I haven't used it underwater OR dropped it...but I plan on bringing it underwater next week when I go on vacation, so cross your fingers it holds up.The only complaint I have is transferring the images to my computer:1. I tried three different USB camera card readers, and only one of them worked. And even then, the transferring is incredibly slooooooow. And I haven't been able to figure out how to move my videos onto my computer...2. I tried the installation cd (twice), but both times it froze up my laptop, so I gave up on that.3. Lastly, I tried plugging in the camera with the included USB cord (which was my last resort because it drains the battery in the camera). This way seems to be the quickest, although I still can't locate my movie files...Hope this review helps someone. I would definitely recommend this camera, and if I had to I would absolutely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ryno
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything that it advertises. It takes great pictures above and below water as long as the water is clear.  The video feature works quite well also.

Reviews.Title: great outdoor  camera
Reviews.Author: Jaime Sada
Reviews.Content: Its a great camera for all situations, rafting, hicking, swimming etc. Nice image quality, good performance.Image quality suffer if you have a backlight ilumination.But I recomended after all.

Reviews.Title: Smooth skin at last!!!
Reviews.Author: Cindy A. Orozco
Reviews.Content: This camera has many great selling points, but I'm having fun with the scene selections such as soft skin. It allows me many options and the owner's manual is easy to use. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: SIZE & USABILITY
Reviews.Author: Edward Kaplan "FastFoto"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 is all the camera that I'd hoped it would be and more. It's my first pocket camera that actually fits in my pocket. The JPEG mode of the movie mode is excellent when it's finalized on a disk. The HD mode is great, but it's appreciation is limited to using directly to an HDTV. The software that came with the camera lives up to the claim of vertical stiching, plus the camera itself has a stitching setting the helps align a portion of the previous shot with the next.

Reviews.Title: It was fun for the 10 days
Reviews.Author: Jason Mcgorty "jasihn"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation in Italy for 2 weeks, half expecting it to break at the beach.  The first time I placed it in water I cringed, but the waterproofing appeared to work fine.I took some fun photos at the beach and inside of fountains in Rome.  About 3/4 of the way into the trip the screen flickered.  I shut it off and when I turned it back on again it made a very bad grinding noise and said the battery can't be used.  It never worked again.I give it 3 stars though since it was a fun 10 days.  Sure it costed about $5 a picture but I got some good shots!And I've been in contact with Panasonic and Amazon about what to do as I didn't mistreat it or anything.

Reviews.Title: Consider alternatives, particularly for video
Reviews.Author: Kenneth P Kloppenborg Jr "kenincolorado"
Reviews.Content: Before buying the Panasonic DMC-TS1 consider other options, like flushing $400 cash down the toilet instead.  You'll save yourself a lot of time and frustration.The camera takes mediocre pictures and does seem to be waterproof and shockproof, as advertised.  The (slightly) extended zoom is useful - IF you can get the auto focus to work.  Auto Focus doesn't work in any sort of low contrast situation - a cloudy day with snow covering the ground, for instance.  One would expect that selecting "Landscape" mode would fix the focus on infinity, but it doesn't.  Don't bother looking for a manual focus.  Panasonic left this commonly available feature out.  Even if the camera did focus in snowy weather, the controls are near impossible to operate with gloves on.  The camera CAN record audio - but only during a movie or 5 seconds at a time when you take a picture.  Panasonic left the audio only recording  feature out too.  The form factor is also a problem and I've ruined many a picture getting a finger partially over the lens which, by the way, has no external cover when the camera is off.Battery life is poor in my experience.  So you need to buy a second battery.  Buyer beware !!!  Panasonic has sabotaged the camera by planting a logic bomb in the camera programming making it impossible to use any battery not manufactured and sold by Panasonic.  Users of other batteries - even ones with the correct electrical characteristics - will see the message "You cannot operate the camera with this battery" and the camera will shut down.  Expect to pay a premium for a spare battery - if you can find one at all, availability being another Panasonic problem.If you're buying the camera for AVCHD Lite video, patience is required.  Panasonic could have chosen to make this the best feature of the camera, instead the included software makes actually using or backing up video a long, confusing, frustrating slog.  Panasonic claims their camera is suitable for use with a 500 MHz computer.  It is - but you can't play video.  I'm using a 1.76 GHz processor and can only play at 10 fps.  The fine print requires a 2.16 GHz dual core for the video the work, so if you don't have one of the latest in processors, expect disappointing results.If you're new to AVCHD and expect to drag and drop your movies like the more standard .mov  file - forget it!  AVCHD movies must be saved in a strict hierarchical directory structure to play at all.  Complicating matters is that the camera itself uses another format to store the videos and conversion must be done during acquisition using the software that comes with the camera.  The software Panasonic included is apparently prone to getting clobbered by other applications in the Windows  XP environment.  I've had to reinstall several times as error messages flagging lost CODEC's and .dll files randomly appear after days or weeks of normal operation.  There's a panorama maker which makes good looking panoramas - at extremely low resolution - nowhere near suitable for actually printing.  There's two other photo editing programs which seemed generous to me until I figured out I needed one to acquire the videos and the second one to actually edit them.The software is buggy.  The ArcSoft Media Impressions application window spilled off the bottom of the monitor.  All the function buttons were invisible because they were at the bottom of the window, below the bottom of the monitor.  You can't point and click to resize when you can't see the lower window border, and the ALT - Space menu had no effect.  The very basic window resize function simply didn't work.  The program couldn't be used owing to a programming blunder of astonishing magnitude.  A different "View" option brought the functions to where they were usable - but then other things disappeared off the bottom of the screen.  MediaImpressions also tendes to take up 100% of the CPU cycles even when it is idle.  I've had to use the task manager more than once to kill it.  The Panasonic PhotoFun application was oft times confusing due, apparently, to lack of familiarity with the English language.  Having figured all that out, I found there were some recorded videos that simply refused to be acquired or played.  The camera could play the videos all the way through, so the information was there, but PhotoFun could not acquire them, could not even see them on the SD card.  Near as I can tell, these videos are effectively lost.  If you're going to take videos that absolutely, positively can not be lost, another product is recommended.  According to some online forums, many have simply thrown away the included software and gone out and paid more money for software that had some actual utility.I wouldn't buy this camera if I had known.  For the future, Panasonic goes to the very bottom of my list next time I think about buying a camera.

Reviews.Title: underwater usage
Reviews.Author: Russell W. Claus "phobos"
Reviews.Content: Initially, I enjoyed this camera and it worked well, zoom was a little troubling, but not enough to make up for the underwater feature. Used on first snorkeling vacation: everything was great. Second snorkeling vacation, salt water leakage, dead camera. I worked to keep the unit clean.I don't think I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Well pleased
Reviews.Author: Randall Garrett "Sr. Sketch"
Reviews.Content: I review and test various products used by field service workers - that is, people who make their living working outdoors a good deal of the time vs. those who work indoors, primarily behind a desk.  One of the tools they use for every job is a digital camera.  The vast majority of these people are self employed vs. draw a salary from a large corporation and equipment they purchase is paid for by themselves.  Perhaps the single most common point of failure for digital cameras in this price range is the zoom lens mechanism.  Thus, this camera one of a few we recommend for outdoor use.  The 28mm (equiv) wide setting is most appreciated by users and the zoom is adequate for most conditions.  The waterproof, dust and drop ratings are appropriate for these people.  This particular camera is very well received by this market.  Photos made are more than adequate.  Of note - the primary aspect ratio for photos is 4:3 vs. the more consumer desirable 16:9.  As with almost every camera in this price range, unfortunately there is no optical viewfinder and the flash is characteristically weak.  Will be purchasing the newly announced Pentax Optio W80 next to test.  The previous W60 was inadequate.  Hope these thoughts help a prospective purchaser.

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: J. Alberto Romo Garza "Jorge Romo"
Reviews.Content: Toma muy buenas fotos con una calidad excelente y sobre todo que siempre salen bien. Es muy dificil que una foto salga movida. La construccion se ve solida y de buena calidad. Muy recomendable.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 camera failed within 1 minute of touching watter
Reviews.Author: G. Brooke
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for a 7 day Caribbean cruise.  We had hoped to take pictures while snorkeling in Cozumel, swimming with the sting rays in Grand Cayman, and hanging out on the beach in Jamaica.  The pictures quality was fine and we took a number of pictures on our first two days of the cruise.  I was surprised to find I preferred the quality of my old 8MP Cannon SD1100IS for pictures taken indoors.  But the real reason we bought this camera was to use in the water and it failed miserably.  I did not get a single picture while snorkeling in Cozumel, because the camera failed shortly after jumping in the water.  Luckily my brother-in-law had a Cannon D10 underwater camera we could use while in Grand Cayman.I sent the camera back to Panasonic and the Customer Service was fantastic.  They replaced my DMC-TS1 with the latest model the DMC-TS2.  The DMC-TS2 has been great.  I've taken the TS2 snorkeling in Cancun, on day hikes in in the rain, to the pool many times, to the local water park and on several canoe trips including a three day float on the Devils river which included snorkeling.  The camera has taken quite a bit of beating and has remained totally waterproof.  I definitely recommend the TS2 and Panasonic customer support.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera but be sure test its waterproof capabilities
Reviews.Author: Howard Ostrow
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a camera that I could take on water related activities such as kayaking and snorkeling and that could also function as general purpose digital camera.  I was delighted when I read the specs.  The camera worked fine until I took it for some light snorkeling.  I was able to take 5 pictures before it died.  I took the pictures with only my head underwater.  The next day I noticed condensation in the camera itself.  So much for it being waterproof.  The SD memory card still had the pictures on it so I was able to salvage them but the camera was useless.  Amazon was great at exchanging it so I try another one which I have yet to be able to do.  The camera did work just fine for taking pictures while kayaking and it did survive one dunk in the ocean.  Note:  The camera will not float so I bought a floating collar which worked well.As a digital camera it takes very good pictures.  The software takes a bit to get used to, just like all modern digital cameras.  The camera is not "fast" in that you have to leave some time for "recovery" in between pictures.  I'm using very fast rated SD card so it's not the memory that is the issue.  My one gripe is that there is no cover for the lens so scratches are going to eventually an issue.  There is no viewfinder which I kind of miss so you have to rely on the LCD display which is very viewable.  As for the orange color it helped  me spot it when it fell out my pocket into the water.

Reviews.Title: Rugged Waterproof + Fantastic Picture Quality = Win
Reviews.Author: Michael Trotman
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased the Olympus Stylus 1050SW 10.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Silver) but the photo quality was terrible.  Yes, the Olympus was sturdy and waterproof, but I was so disappointed with the photo quality I stopped using it.  Finally Panasonic entered the rugged camera arena and they have figured out how to deliver excellent photo quality in a rugged design.  Read this article from infosynch and you can see comparisons of photos taken with three different rugged cameras.  The Panasonic wins in every category hands down.[..]

Reviews.Title: Perfect!! camera for all moment!!! woww under water!!!
Reviews.Author: F. Miranda
Reviews.Content: Increible under water..good resolution, excelnte videos under water..must to buy..this camera is amazing!!! plus in the night has a light that turn on automatic..really funny this cam!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Solid cameraThree reasons I brought this camera:1. 720 video capture is not bad for a digital picture camera2. Waterproof3. use SD instead of XD memory like the OlympusPicture quality is nothing to be excited about..It would be nice if it can waterproof to 33 ft like the OlympusCons:It is kinda expensive..

Reviews.Title: Island + Rainy/Hot weather = grueling conditions for a camera
Reviews.Author: principessa
Reviews.Content: I live life ruggedly, so, this little thing fits just perfectly into the kind of rough and tumble life I lead.  I had owned probably at least 5 to 6 digital cameras in my lifetime, and several film cameras both point-and-shoot and professional SLRs and then... I had a son, who loves to take pictures as much as I do.  Well, 2 of the digital cameras he broke.  I tried to get him a kiddie one, and that got wet with a drink spillage.  The others got ruined with the sand and the elements.  I used to have a light olympus that was waterproof and boy was I totally excited by that, especially at the water park where I was taking great close up shots in the children's watersplash area and sure enough my camera fell into the water.  But I was so proud it didn't get spoiled.  Well, the photos were mediocre.  This Lumix on the other hand, I get all sorts of compliments for great photos taken!  For all the hassle saved on repairs and heartaches over broken camera pieces, I was ready to fork the money over and grab the cool looking piece of equipment that takes (better point and shoot pictures) than my current Canon 10zoom.  I love my canon, but it's too bulky!  And it drains battery like nobody's business!  (I used rechargeable AA for the canon).  The Lumix, I keep it in my purse and I charge it probably every other week (Thank you for slim rechargable batteries!)  The only drawback is the HD, and I have a Mac, so they don't mesh.  Pls fix this (Panasonic?) (Or anyone, please let me know if there's an update?).  IF you're planning on getting the Tz-7 (Panasonic's 10x version, just know that the screen isn't so great (cracks easily) I bought one and within a week, blech).  Google the "problems with TZ7".  I recommend getting this Lumix TS1 instead.

Reviews.Title: HD Jetski Camcorder!
Reviews.Author: John R. Mcalpine V "Mac"
Reviews.Content: This camera does exactly what I want.  I can capture great quality images and videos without fear of damaging my camera from water or abuse.  Check out our video from our MACSBOOST Honda Aquatrax watercraft.  We were cruising down the Waccamaw river with friends.[...]I was holding the camera by hand while driving at over 50mph!  The video is very smooth and steady when the ride was not.  I assure you that I'm not that good holding the camera!The image stabilization is remarkable!The camera has proved tough enough to live in my trunks pocket while we riding a standup Jetski too.

Reviews.Title: NOT RUGGED & TERRIBLE CUST SERVICE! BEWARE!!!
Reviews.Author: E. Melcher
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!  DO NOT FLY WITH THIS CAMERA!!!  BUYER BEWARE!!!We purchased this camera last spring to use on vacations in the pool and snorkeling.  Camera worked well until we took a trans-Atlantic flight and placed the camera securely in a camera bag in the overhead bin.  When we arrived at our destination there was a large crack in the LCD viewing panel on the back of the camera, while there was no damage to our video camera or the other camera contained in the same case.  Needless to say we were not impressed that our supposedly 'rugged' camera broke in a situation when no damage should have come to it.  We feel the air pressure in the plane caused this crack.Upon contacting the Panasonic customer service, they told me it would be covered under our warranty, but apparently THEY LIED.  After spending more hard earned cash to mail them their easily broken camera, we received a letter saying to was not covered under warranty and please pay $200 for someone else's refurbished junky camera.  I was incensed and spent many hours trying to fight with their customer service on this, but my pleas feel on deaf ears.  So, I asked them to send the original broken junky camera back to me and now 2 weeks later, I have still not received it.PANASONIC IS A TERRIBLE COMPANY WITH INFERIOR PRODUCTS AND RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  BUYER BEWARE.  IF YOU BUY THIS CAMERA DO NOT FLY WITH IT!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1
Reviews.Author: SlingerDun
Reviews.Content: Almost two years and tens of thousands of images later and it's working almost good as new, except for the auto-focus bracket(s) which locks in - disappears - then engages again IF the shutter remains half pressed. No big deal, but it is now slower than before and it never was fast, except for the interface.Besides dropping it from over 5 feet and debris collecting between the rubber water seals; keeping the lens protected and smudge free seems to be the biggest concern with this camera, along with a charged battery.Battery life is mediocre at best and spares are expensive: NON PANASONIC BATTERIES DO NOT WORK IN THIS CAMERA ONCE THE FIRMWARE HAS BEEN UPDATED TO ~ Ver.1.2Image quality is still average, it's still water and dust proof, plenty of micro scratches on the exposed lens that do not effect image quality.Japanese earthquake prices have climbed closer to the $400 tag this camera was released with over two years ago.

Reviews.Title: Not a good everyday camera
Reviews.Author: Hal
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading some good reviews about its image quality and HD video capabilities.  I currently own a Canon Powershot G10 and a Canon 40D digital SLR and have been very happy with the great image quality of my Canon cameras.  The thing I like about the Panasonic Lumix is that it takes very nice HD video both on land and in the swimming pool.  The video motion is very smooth and the colors are very accurate.  I also like the compact size of the camera and the very well designed wrist strap.  I liked the wrist strap so much that I ordered an additional one through Panasonic to use on my Canon G10.  Almost everything else about this camera, I find that it is inferior to my Canon G10 and  that it is not a good choice if this is the only camera you own.It is very difficult to take a sharp photo with this camera due to its poor image stabilization, poor indoor lighting performance, hard to hold camera steady while pressing the shutter button due to its small size, poor computer auto white balance.  Almost half of all the pictures I take end up blurry.  The menu system on the Panasonic camera is poorly designed and counterintuitive.  My Canon G10 is a really pleasure to navigate through the menu system and making setting changes before taking the photo.  Battery life on the Panasonic is poor especially if you take video.  The video while it has great image quality is difficult to work with as most computer will stuggle with editing the AVCHD format.  This format requires a computer with the latest processors and lots and lots of memory.  Indoor pictures if taken without flash are basically useless as the images are grainy and blurry.  I also prefer the colors of the Canon cameras over those of the Panasonics.  In summary, I would say the the Panasonic TS1 is a better camcorder than it is a photo camera.

Reviews.Title: blurriest pictures EVER
Reviews.Author: Kristie G
Reviews.Content: oh my, I have to say I hate this camera. hate. it's a strong word, but really I don't have a better one to describe it. I have owned nikons, canons, pentax, etc. I was quite excited to try this one because it has a leica lens, but unfortunately I don't see any benefit from it being a leica- think picture sharpness must have been sacrificed for durability.  It's really horrible.  lack of depth, lack of contract, lack of quality.. worst. camera. ever.

Reviews.Title: Horrible audio quality
Reviews.Author: Poseidon
Reviews.Content: The video quality of the camera is pretty good. I compared it with a creative vado HD, and the TS1 was much better in almost all respects. However, I was greatly disappointed to note that the TS1 records an excessively high background audio noise (hiss). It is excruciatingly high and is extremely distracting when viewing any video. I have had to do further audio processing to remove the noise, but that adds another step to my workflow. I tried it with the 'wind cut' feature on and off. It didn't make any difference, though I didn't expect it to since the only videos i have taken so far are in my room, which is pretty quiet. Compared to the Creative Vado HD, the audio noise is so high that I am wondering whether I have been shipped a faulty unit.I would love to receive comments from other users' experience with the audio quality of this camera. Of course, to hear how bad the background noise is, you would have to be recording with normal conversational volume in a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: Is not waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Alaska Anna
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on buying a camera to be able to take on my Hawaii trip & do some snorkeling with.  I wanted one that had great picture quality, zoom features, & most importantly - ability to take pictures & high quality video in & out of water.  I found that this camera looked to fit my needs.It worked ok for taking pictures above water.  The zoom wasn't very good & hard to operate, it didn't freeze action in auto mode, there isn't too much manual control & if there is it takes time to get to.  The design of the camera made it hard to put the wristband around your wrist and also take a picture.  You had to really hold the camera funny.The worst part of this camera for me though was that it completely died the moment it touched water.  We went to a lot of trouble to get a waterproof camera so we could bring home underwater shots from this trip & despite checking to make sure nothing would mess up seals & doing everything recommended it's just a badly made product and the water came flooding in.  We called the company hoping they could help us by sending a replacement immediately so the thousands of dollars we've spent on a Hawaii trip wouldn't be wasted & we could still get our underwater photography but they were VERY unhelpful, no apologies, just got a - well maybe after you send it back to us we'll check it out and in a month or so we'll send you a refurbished one.We ended up finding a place to rent us a Olympus older model for $20 a day and just rented it for one day.  I talked with many other people over there and they had the new Olympus and were very happy with it's preformance & water tight seals.  If this camera could actually produce what they advertise it would be a great camera, otherwise you may want to wait till they get their kinks out in the waterproofing area.There is the Canon D10 but it didn't have very high quality video & no sound.  The Olympus seems to be the most reliable & best quaity out there currently.

Reviews.Title: Good Product. As expected. No compains. If you compare prices and is the best, there is no hold back to it.
Reviews.Author: MARCOS Y YOSIDA
Reviews.Content: Good Product. As expected. No compains. If you compare prices and is the best, there is no hold back to it.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: A. Castricone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera six months ago never really had any problems with it until I took it in the water bout waist deep. I followed all manufactures specifications. After wading in the water about waist deep for approx. 10 minuets the camera never turned on again. It was right at the beginning of a trip to a remote festival in Ukraine and I was not able to take any pictures of my trip really ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: HD Video Caution
Reviews.Author: Marycarol M. Skaggs
Reviews.Content: The camera is very comparable to the Olympus Stylus waterproof with some differences other reviewers have mentioned.  The on-button does have a delay.  I didn't think it was a big deal at first, but now I see that it might cause me to miss some shots I'm trying to get.  The image stabilizer is every bit as great at that of the Stylus!!  Shake the camera all around, snap the pic, and it still comes out perfectly clear.  Yay!The real issue that I want to alert other readers about is the HD video.  The settings on the camera are HD or MPEG.  What I didn't know is that the camera will only take up to 8 min of vid in MPEG mode, while in HD I can create videos as long as the card will allow.  The problem is that nothing I have recognizes the new video format, and I can't use any video I've taken in the ACVHG lite format.  So if you're getting excited about the HD, please make sure that it's not so you can email them or post them onto FB, and also make sure that you have Windows 7.  The software will burn the HD vid's onto DVD, but that's not how I wanted to use this.Overall it seems to be a good camera so far, I'm just a little bummed about the video issue.  It shouldn't be that hard.

Reviews.Title: very good model
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Elhati
Reviews.Content: It deserves more than its price. It is very good camera from all prospective 'specially from the standpoint of the average user.

Reviews.Title: best photo quality
Reviews.Author: Douglas A. Kaye
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera from Amazon last week and have shot several photos of flowers and birds.  The pixel quality is unreal, the best pictures I have ever taken.  I have to say it is the easiest point and shoot I have ever used.  Light and compact the view screen is clear and intuitive.  I like the battery life so far, and look forward to using the HD video feature.  The internal memory is a great idea, but I will purchase a SD card soon.  Thank you, Doug

Reviews.Title: could be better, I would suggest for you to wait for the TS2
Reviews.Author: J. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and I really wanted to like it . Waterproof, shockproof camera with 12.1mp , 4.6x optical zoom and hd recording ? you can't go wrong with that until you receive it . What they forgot to mention you is that this camera if for any reason at all falls even within the 5 feet the guarantee, it will void the waterproof warranty if you dont send it back for inspection prior to dunk it underwater . What kind of warranty is this? I was not happy with that . It also states that you need to take it every year for the sealant replacement to ensure the camera is still capable of going underwater. This is a camera that requires lots of maintenance . Also the picture quality is blurry at times and in low light conditions is horrible. I did like the part that if you want to take pictures the optical zoom increases without sacrificing picture quality but the picture quality to begin with is not that great. HD recording however was a little nice but it wont record at 60 frames per second which i think its really a turn off because fish underwater move really fast and you dont want that ghosting effect while recording fast moving things. The camera is kinda bulky and the construction is not as strong as the olympus waterproof cameras. The battery compartment tends to leak if you are not really careful, I think this is a major problem with the camera because there's been lots of reports of people complaining about the camera leaking and breaking even after following the instructions given on the owner's manual. The idea was good but since this is the very first camera that panasonic releases , I suggest for you to wait for the next upcoming model to see if they improve all those flaws from this camera. I know the new camera coming in april will have better construction and will be 14.1mp . Hopefully they will fix all those bugs from the AI setting and add 60 frames per second to their recording . I ended up returning and I got a Sony cybershot tx7 , it is not waterproof but its way better than this camera in every other category. If you want something for waterproof , I suggest you instead spent on the canon waterproof camera instead of this one.

Reviews.Title: Camera okay, but power options are a show stopper
Reviews.Author: CRAIG LYKINS "Craig"
Reviews.Content: This very expensive camera does not come with a power cord to charge the battery.  You must remove the battery and plug it into a wall outlet.  That is not very convenient if all our outlets are hard to access.Fine. So I purchased the DMW-AC5 cable, which Panasonic claims is compatible with the Lumix series of cameras.  This is a VERY expensive power cable indeed. And guess what? It does not even plug into the Lumix DMS-TS1 unless you buy yet another adapter cable.What a scam.  You end up paying 20-25% of the price of the camera all over again, just to charge the stupid battery.So, I am done with Panasonic cameras.  Learn your lesson Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Mark Schow
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money.  Because it's waterproof you only get the digital zoom - an optical zoom is better, but that's the trade.  It takes good photos.  I don't think you can adjust the aperture - or at least I can't find it.

Reviews.Title: solid camera
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Solidly built.  Completely adequate image quality for a PAS camera.  Lens tends to fog on the inside in cold water...went swimming in Maine in 57-60 degree water and the inside of the lens seemed to fog up.  Macro mode works excellent.  Needs a longer-lasting battery.  In all, not as good as my last Canon PAS but still perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: Eric Jain
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera -- until I tried using it underwater, as advertised. It lasted all of two minutes. Turns out this is a common problem; sent it for warranty replacement and got a DMC-TS2 back. Hope I'll have better luck with that model!

Reviews.Title: not user friendly
Reviews.Author: Tien D. Bui
Reviews.Content: Originally had the canon D10 water proof camera and wanted a "smaller" waterproof camera so bought this one which it was.  I found that the "on" button was difficult to push and often took several times to push.  Granted it is flushed with the case to prevent accident off and on, it usually takes me several times to turn it on. Also, the turn on speed and the start video speed is a bit slow.  The user buttons are not as friendly as the canon. Also has features that do not make much sense like the "note" function. Why? Pictures in the factory setting tend to be a bit "yellow."  Took it snorkeling and did some rigorous "slashing" and it leaked and cause the SD card to malfunction.  I had to dry it out.  Now...the real annoying thing.  What the heck is up with the movie files format (MOV).  None of the common viewers will play it.  Also windows move maker can't open it.  All the conversion programs include Quicktime Pro shrink the image quality.  Why why why?  A previous reviewer wrote.."Others have apparently had trouble using the AVCHD Lite codec, but I have not.
